Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: SoxGirl982
Reviews.Content: I can't even review the hotel room itself because I did not even end up staying here. My boyfriend and I had tickets to a concert at the House of Blues, so we decided to book a room here this past Wednesday. This was the day after the "Boston Blackout", so some of the city was still without power. After calling the concert venue to see if they had power (they did, concert was a go), I must have called the hotel 6-8 times, each time not getting any voicemail, just ringing and ringing. I also sent two e-mails and never heard back. Upon arrival, I could see the hotel was dark, and a small sign posted on the front door stating that the hotel was closed due to the power outage. I approached the front desk and was quickly told by an annoyed looking woman that my reservation for that evening was no longer valid. I was a bit taken aback by how rude she was off the bat. I asked her if they would be able to help me in getting another room in the city. She shot back that they had no power, how would she be able to help me with that? (This was said in between her texting on her cell phone). I asked what they were going to be able to do to help me, as I had booked the hotel because of its low rates, and most other rooms in the city would be upwards of $300. She once again told me that there was nothing she could do because "ummm, I told you, we have NO power!" and tossed me a piece of paper with the name and phone number of a hotel across the city (already booked up when we called). I completely understand why the hotel had to close due to the power outage, but it baffles me that they could not take a few simple steps to make lines of communication better (forwarding their phone lines to employees cell phones?) Also, it is shocking to me in that this hotel would not even try to do something to retain the business of those who were put out. Perhaps offering to rebook all the effected guests at partial or full cost to the hotel or even offering a complimentary or reduced nights stay at some point in the future? In the end, we were lucky enough to book at the Colonnade (can not recommend them enough, so kind and helpful!), no thanks to the awful staff at the Hotel Buckminster. I advise everyone to stay far away from this hotel that doesn't seem to care a bit about the satisfaction of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicole N
Reviews.Content: I like the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk staff. The hotel is not in the downtown area but still easily accessible by subway. In fact I like that it is quiet, but still safe. From there, I had a nice stroll to Prudential Centre and along the way there were a lot to see- some European style houses, churches etc. The staff introduced me to a couple of excellent restaurants that are just across the street. The only thing I wasn't happy with was that there wasn't any electric water heater in the room but only a microwave oven. I assume not everyone would have a microwavable container during their travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: The journey from Boston airport to this hotel was about 20 mins in light traffic, and only cost $30. When we approached the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised as it is located within a beautiful building. When checking in and out, all staff were friendly, efficient and knowledgable. The common areas were very well presented, and included vending machines, cash machine, laundry & kitchen areas, free wi-fi and also a computer room with printer - costing around $6 per 15mins use. The room was clean, but tired - although maintenance work was being carried out all the time, and clearly the rooms are slowly being improved (we were not disturbed by this work though). The view from the room reflected the area - which isn't picturesque, but pleasant enough. Inside, the room was spacious with plenty of storage, including a double wardrobe and seperate built-in cupboard. It also included tv (plenty of channels), microwave, fridge, safe, telephone, alarm clock radio, hairdryer. Bathroom was clean and tidy, with all the usual toiletries etc. Plenty of hot water and powerful shower. Breakfast was served in the adjoining restaurant, which can be accessed via the lobby, and therefore doesn't really feel seperate from the hotel, which is good. There is a good selection of items for a continental breakfast - waffles, bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, pastries, muffins etc. Again, staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was great, with a subway station within two minutes walk. To get into town on foot, was a good 30 minutes, but a nice walk. This also takes you past the Cheers pub, various buildings and parks. Around the hotel, it seemed like a safe area and we felt comfortable walking about at night. There are plenty of restaurants nearby - covering all types of food and budgets. There is also couple of convenience stores, which is handy. Overall, the hotel was good value and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BosAnonymous
Reviews.Content: I booked the Buckminster by chance through Hotwire's anonymous deals. I paid about $93 inclusive of all taxes and fees. At first, I held my breath as I read somewhat polarizing reviews about the Buckminster. I was pleased that my experience was positive. I was able to get an early check-in at 12:30 although the room was on the small side (room 320). It was, however, clean and quiet (with only a view of the adjacent building). As mentioned by others, the hotel appears to have been renovated relatively recently. The staff was courteous. The breakfast buffett was adequate--basically carbs, carbs and more carbs. I ate only fruits. Of course, the virtue of this hotel is its central location in Kenmore Square. The Commonwealth Hotel down the street would cost at least twice as much. For the price I paid, I thought I got a decent value for my stay. I would book again at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel!! Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Yasmin87
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel for the price. Yummy breakfast to boost the energy, free wifi and excellent location within walking distance of Fenway park, Newbury and the Prudential tower. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel,small price, well localized”
Reviews.Author: hrrf
Reviews.Content: I stay here for one day.Lobby OK. Service was fast and very corteous staff.Elevator small as europeans hotels.The room was small but clean,with a double bed, LCD TV,desk and office chair, complimentary Internet,small refrigerator and microwave. Bathroom updated,clean with complimentary personal care stuff.The complimentary continental breakfast is good and plenty( Bagels,english muffins,cream cheese,jams, waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, coffee, juices,etc).The hotel is practically in Boston University.Kenmore Green line T station is crossing the street; from here to everywhere in Boston including Logans Airport for $2. Many restaurants, fast foods,bars, banks in the surroundings.Barnes&Noble crossing the street.Fenway park and a mall with cinemas,restaurants, and several stores at walking distance. For $99 in Boston,all of these, give me a break!!!! Great for BU parents.

Reviews.Title: “Kenmore's best secret!”
Reviews.Author: mozart15
Reviews.Content: I am a devoted fan of TripAdvisor, and I decided to head to Boston last weekend to watch the Superbowl. After looking on tripadvisor, i settled on the Hotel Buckminster, and boy was i glad i did. This hotel is in a perfect location near Fenway Park. It is a bit out of the way from the more touristy areas, but the Kenmore Square Green line subway is next door, and easy access to all of Boston. We arrived and met a very nice fellow named Scott, and while check-in was at 3, he allowed us to go up to our room at 1. The room was small, but clean, and very comfortable with a Queen bed. It was a cute hotel setup, since the building is sort of like a horseshoe shape. I wasn't aware, but the famous architect Mr. White (of McKim, Mead, White fame) designed this! Anyhow, the hotel was clean, the staff wonderful, and for an inexpensive place which is next to Fenway, i highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, cheap compared to other Boston Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Loopyloodles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in October 2011. It is in a great location, near a selection of bars and restaurants, the student district, and has good transport links to the harbour side of Boston. We walked from this hotel down to the harbour, it was a beautiful walk through lovely parks and gave us a chance to look at the architecture of the houses and buildings, took us about 30 mins leisurely. The hotel had a car park which we had booked but it was a little tiny for the size of US cars. The hotel was clean and tidy, nice lobby area, continental breakfast was basic but I loved the fruit in the US, and they had plenty of it at this breakfast. We were a bit amazed that we had a microwave but no tea or coffee making facilities. Our room was basic and old but it added to the experience of Boston. It was clean which was the main thing, big bathroom too. The hotel was one of the cheapest in Boston, however, we found Boston hotels very expensive compared to places like New York. We went to Salem, it was half an hours drive and a fun experience. Boston was beautiful and the Buckminster is a good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Weiye C
Reviews.Content: 2 great nights there. The hotal is located near Kenmore station and Fenway Park. The room (or suite) is soooooo big and contains 3 TVs, microwave and refrigerator. Over $90 per night with free breakfast. Although some things(TVs, lamps) are old and the Wifi is not good enough, I will choose this hotel next time if I want to watch a Red Sox game.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tilly G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of our tour around New England in October 2011. The room was clean and the bathroom was spacious and really well equipped. Breakfast was served in the Japanese restaurant next door and was a nice selection of cold pastries, cereal and juices. There was work going on in the lobby while we were there which was good and seemed as though it was needed, but it didn't disturb us and I can't imagine that it would still be going on. The hotel had parking which was just next door - really useful if you're travelling with a lot of luggage and a less mobile friend or relation. The best thing about this hotel is the location; it's really easy to get around. Eat at Eastern Standard which is just around the corner - the food was phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in early January- just over US$90/night after taxes Pros - Good location very close to Kenmore station (lots of subway trains to city 5-6stops) - Complementary 60min wifi connection. - Complementary continental breakfast provided - pastries/toast/cereals/fruit/tea/coffee/juices. Good selection of simple products. -Good sized rooms - Laundry room provided $2 each for wash/dry. (only takes quarter - they did not have quarters to spare at the reception) - Microwave and bar fridge provided. - Good selection of TV channels over 50+ Cons -Noisy room 411 facing highway. Majority of rooms at the back of hotel (hotel is a funny triangle shape with base facing highway). Try to get a room facing the front road if you can. -No tea/coffee facilities. Great value hotel apart of the noisy highway. Everything else was good!

Reviews.Title: “A historic hotel in the middle of Kenmore Square around the corner from Fenway & many restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyb0609
Reviews.Content: This is an old, but clean & comfortable hotel. It's easy to find. There's a T station right down the street (which is how we traveled), but plenty of parking nearby if you choose to drive. Fenway is a walk around the corner. We hit Boston Beer Works for dinner, always delicious! We have stayed here before in one of the smallest rooms, which is fine if you're heading to a Sox game and aren't planning to spend hours in the room. This time we had a 2 bedroom apartment with a living room, small refrigerator & microwave. Great if you have 4 or more people! The hotel has an interesting history. Babe Ruth was a frequent guest & it is said that the World Series scandal involving Shoeless Joe Jackson was set up at Buckminster! Expect some noise such as sirens in the middle of the night...you are sleeping on a main intersection in the middle of Boston, but it's bearable. And if you have a room like we did, it's worth a little noise to be able to peek out the window & be staring directly at the iconic Citgo sign!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm_111
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel considering I paid less than $100 a night, which is cheap by Boston standards. Just a short walk from the subway station as well (Kenmore), literally a stones throw away from Fenway Park for baseball fans. From previous reports I assume the hotel has recently been renovated as the room was very clean and modern looking, with a wide screen tv as well. The room was a good size and the beds very comfortable. Surprised the hotel didn't provide a few sachets of coffee, only a small thing but seemed a bit incongruous given the quality of the room. If your a light sleeper you may want to get a room away from the inside on the lower floors as I could hear the air-conditioning units, though it didn't personally disturb my sleep. The hotel serves a good continental breakfast in the Japanese restaurant next door. Overall I found it good value for money and for the price I paid would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Underrated, comfy and well located”
Reviews.Author: Dante M
Reviews.Content: I took this hotel for my first 2 days, as the one I wanted was not available, and it was a good surprise. Their website looks like old and they are underrated in here. They are a cross-street to the red line (best subway line in boston) , with lots of restaurants very close to it (from mcdonalds to very nice pizza and steak house places) ..there are some bars and nightlife too, since it is very close to the Boston University Campus. In fact, many guests of this hotel are young and polite, looking for good prices and a nice stay. Staff is really nice and the room is comfy, very good bed and a good shower too. Everything is clean and do not smell bad (I though it would be since it has an old appearance on the website). It is cheaper than most of the other places and a good option for who is willing to save money and time with transportation. They have 1 hour free wifi, and them u have to pay (only thing I disliked about it).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room set up”
Reviews.Author: TripPlanners
Reviews.Content: Recently my son and husband planned a sports weekend in Boston. It was very difficult to find any accommodation that was reasonably priced yet accessible to everything. I searched the other trip advisor sites and found this one. This hotel had mixed reviews. I was getting desperate and when I booked there was only a few rooms left. They ended up with the two bedroom. When they got to Boston they found it very close to the subway and were very happy. The two bedroom looked over towards Fenway park. It was clean and had many conveniences. They were not in the room much. They found that the breakfast was adequate and a good way to start the day. They also enjoyed several of the restaurants close by. This is definitely not the Ritz but the two of them had no complaints. I think you have to ask yourself what you want out of a hotel. If it is ambience and the pampered feeling then this is not the place. If you want something reasonable, close to the subway, clean and roomy (especially the 2 bedroom) then you might want to consider this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, clean!”
Reviews.Author: ctblubird
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great and I would definitely go back. My main reason for choosing this hotel was because of its location and it exceeded my expectations in that dept. Here are my reasons:1) Location! I went to Boston for an overnight trip with my daughter and her friend to see a concert at the House of Blues. This hotel was right around the corner - no busy streets to cross. It is a stones throw from Fenway Park as well. It is a half a block away from the T (subway) stop which is approx. 5-10 min. ride to Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall. There are three restaurants, including Uno, attached to this hotel and there are quite a few others within a block's walk. Cambridge is a 3-5 minute drive or you can walk over the bridge (it has a walking path). Ten minute walk to Newbury(?) street (shopping). Easy access to the highway. 2) We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. It was plenty big for the 3 of us. You could have slept 6. It may have been tight for 6 people, but definitely do-able. One bedroom had a small kitchenette in with a table, desk, sitting chair. The other bedroom had 2 beds which filled it up. Because we were there for one night, I didn't need the tv. I did try turning it on and there was a problem with the signal. If it wasn't after midnight I would have called the desk, but I didn't bother. The bathroom was a little tight, but clean. The water pressure in the shower was excellent. I wasn't expecting that for such an old building. The character of the building was incredible. There is a fireplace (non working) in this suite. The decor left a little to be desired (no pictures on the walls), but again, we were there to sleep. 3) I paid $179 +tax and $28 for parking. I know the single rooms are less expensive. I thought it was worth it. Not knowing the city of Boston very well, I wanted to be close to the venue and that reason alone made it worth price. You get a continental breakfast which included cereals, muffins, danish, fresh fruit, coffee, tea. Certainly enough to get your day started. The desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. I do not think this hotel has much else by means of amenities (i.e. swimming pool), but I wasn't looking for that. If you're looking for a place to rest and park your car while you explore Boston, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a pit”
Reviews.Author: bruce s
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extremely old, show obvios signs that the staff takes little care of the room as stains are found everywhere. Even with a "complimentary" upgrade my room was terrible and I cannot image how terrible the lower class rooms must be like. Stay anywhere but here my stay here was terrible as the room was filthy and disgusting I did not enjoy my time here at all and rue my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Boston”
Reviews.Author: SophiesMom55
Reviews.Content: I was in boston for a medical conference and wanted a cheaper alternative to the $300+ price of the conference hotel. I found Hotel Buckminster on Tripadvisor and was thrilled with it. It is old, but clean and quiet. The staff was terrific and went out of their way to help me with all my needs. I will always stay there when I am in Boston. What a find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place... nice people!!!”
Reviews.Author: texastravelgal54
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel not knowing if we had picked out a good location or not? The location was good for us real close to the kenmore subway line and right across the street from Fenway park. The hotel elegant and quite, they offered breakfast and it was nice. We would stay here again if i come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lannyr
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. It's in a great location just close enough to downtown to be convenient, far out enough to avoid much of the congestion. There is a subway stop very close so getting around was no problem. The rooms were clean, the elevators fast and laundry facilities for the guests. Breakfast is ordinary but its free. And it is directly across the street from Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- but really awful room”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was pet friendly, in Boston, in an area I really enjoy. The room was just an embarrassment. It was really awful. They charge a 75$ deep cleaning fee for pets- I don't think this hotel has been deep cleaned since the 1980s. That being said- there were some advantages- 1. free overnight parking on Beacon street after meters go off at 6am as long as you move by 8pm which works perfect for someone driving to work in the city 2. great sushi restaurant conjoined to hotel 3. right near fenway park!! lots of bars around the area also I really don't think I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Stay”
Reviews.Author: SeniorRelaxers
Reviews.Content: Following a Saga tour of New England, I decided to stay on and spend some time in Boston. I found this hotel on a website and booked it from the reviews. The hotel has been recently refurbished and is situated just a few minutes walk from the subway. Very friendly and professional reception staff. My initial room was a bit small and I asked if there was a larger one and they changed it with no fuss and then rang afterwards to see whether I was happy with it.Being an older hotel the rooms may vary in size and are over several floors served by two lifts. Some rooms face onto the street, the inner ones, one of which I had, overlook a large rectangular inner courtyard which acts as a light well. There is no problem with this. . Continental Breakfast was included served in the adjoining Japanese restaurant. This was fine! Being a Brit, tea making facilities would have been preferable to the included fridge and microwave, but heating up pizzas or other prepared meals is an easy option and ideal for many guests There is a very good Indian restaurant left out of the hotel and down a couple of blocks on the same side as the hotel An early morning call and the booking of a taxi was also happily arranged for me I would definitely stay there again. Very good service, value and location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for girlfriends getaway”
Reviews.Author: charvista
Reviews.Content: Great experience! Would definitely stay there again!! A long-time friend and I planned a trip to Boston as a reunion after many years living in different areas. We wanted a reasonably priced hotel, with complimentary breakfast, in a safe and convenient location. We found it in the Hotel Buckminister! The staff was exceedingly kind and attentive. They even loaned us an umbrella on a rainy day! The complimentary breakfast was more than satisfactory with bagels, English muffins, toast (w/butter, jellies, cream cheese, peanut butter, and honey),mini-muffins, pastries, variety of cereals, lots of fresh fruit, orange and grape juice, milk, coffee and tea. They even had flavored creams available for coffee!! Our room was very satisfactory and clean with lots of room - even had a microwave and frig. There was a charming old armoire holding the tv with built-in closets on both sides with full-length mirrors on the doors. Although it showed some bare wood from scuff marks on the bottom edges, you could tell it had been very impressive in earlier years - it was very practical and much appreciated by us. The tv was small - but it was more than ok for us to check weather reports, etc. - we didn't go to Boston to watch tv! We also had a small table with two chairs by large span of windows covered by attractive plantation shutters. We enjoyed sitting there and watching the busy sidewalk traffic below where there were many choices of restaurants and even a couple of convenience stores. We chose to use cabs, but the subway was only about a half block or so away - very convenient. We felt very safe in this neighborhood and at this hotel. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Buckminster 1 - Sox 0”
Reviews.Author: Willemite
Reviews.Content: We were in town for two nights. There for the last Red Sox home game and a bit of sightseeing. The weather was unpleasant. Too warm for late September, gray, misty. The Sox lost in part of a memorable end-of-the-season meltdown. Rain precluded much walking on the Freedom Trail. But staying at the Buckminster was one of the more successful aspects of our visit. Our room was on the fifth floor, with a view of the city that was substantial but less than beautiful. Wooden shutters kept out most of the light early in the morning. The room was a decent size. Our King-size bed was comfy, the TV was fine, with a reasonable selection of stations. The bathroom was ok, with real tiles. My only gripe was that, while the water pressure was good, it took a while for the water to reach a hot-enough temperature. Just start the water a few minutes before you are ready and all will be fine. Continental breakfast was garden-variety. Parking is an extra charge, but is immediately next door, so offers no inconvenience other than having to step outside to gain access. And what might it cost to park at Fenway? There is one elevator, which is small and requires negotiating a narrow passage to access, a small challenge when toting large baggage. What the Buckminster has to offer is location, location, location. We were there to attend Fenway, which was an incredibly convenient few blocks distant. Also, a T stop was a mere half-block away. That was particularly handy as well. There is a restaurant in the building, Uno. We ate there once and it was ok. The hotel is not cheap. It cost us about $200 a night. But for a nice older hotel, in a great location, that was not unreasonable. While the attendees at the game (yes, we are renegade New Yorkers who root for the Sawx) struck us as even ruder than our home town fans, the folks working at the hotel were models of courtesy and helpfulness. While we have stayed at nicer hotels in our time, The Buckminster is a great choice if you are in town for a game, and a nice choice even if you are there for other sights.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job (but only just)”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Carol-Hedland
Reviews.Content: The room was smaller than most hotels we have stayed in whilst in the USA (and dearer) However our research had shown when we booked the hotel months ago that there really was nothing else available that suited our criteria. The room itself was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel itself is easily accessible from public transport (the T) and trolley bus tours of the city, stop at Fenway Park, which is only a few hundred metres behind the hotel. Free continental breakfast was more than adequate especially compared to a few of the chain motels we have used. The night we arrived, they were having trouble with their internet, having installed a new system that day. You now only get 60 minutes free for the day and it will cost you $3 an hour or $10 a day after that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: lovethekeys62
Reviews.Content: The Buckminster was in a good location and the staff were friendly and really helpful. Located in Kenmore Square it's close to Fenway Park, House of Blues and many restaurants. Easy walk to the subway. The price was reasonable, as was parking for the night. Our room was spacious and very clean, the bed was comfortable. The continental breakfast was nice. I would definitely stay here again. The rooms may need some updating, but were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just a little old”
Reviews.Author: Suzft
Reviews.Content: I had a dulux queen room. It was all I needed. Modern bathroom, cable tv, window (with a view of a brick wall, but didn't matter as I only slept there an didn't need a view). It was clean, well maintained. Building was a bit dated but I believe they are refurbishing. The location is fantastic. Right near Kenmore station so its easy to get around. Only issue was the price of the room - it was very small so it seemed a bit much to pay as much as I did, but I guess I was really paying for the location which really makes up for it. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “old hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sascrat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, a short walk from a T stop, accross the street from Boston University and a very short walk from Fenway Park. From the outside, it looks great. But then you get inside and realize that the lobby meets expectations, but the hallways and rooms look old and need to be redone. I think our room was clean, but the rugs were so old and the wall so much in need of paint that I am not sure. The lighting was so poor that it was hard to read. We booked at the last minute and they did not have a double room available. So we were booked into a 2 bedroom suite at the double rate. Both rooms had refrigerators and bar sinks. One room had a microwave. The counters by both sinks were cracked and needed to be redone. One room had a broken TV. We reported this, but it was not fixed while we were there. Both TV's were old, analogue 17 inch models. The furniture was old fashioned, which fit the age of the hotel. It looked 40+ years old. The bathroom was well lit and clean. The tile was white and I did not notice any that was chipped. But there was a lack of towel racks. We used one of the extra closets to hang the towels! When in the bathroom, one could hear people in other bathrooms as if they were in our room. That did not happen with the rest of the suite. The breakfast was marginal. Cereal, bad bagels, tiny muffins. The TV in the restaurant was a flat screen, but it was located so only 2 or the 12 or so tables could see it. Location trumped everything with this hotel, but it needs a facelift badly.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Dumpy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjtgibbons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Boston for only 1 night and didn't want to spend an arm and a leg for a less than 24 hour visit. We were flying out of Boston and basically needed a place to sleep. This hotel was the only place close to $200 in a reasonable area. We should have gone with the Westin at close to $400. It was a big room with fireplace and a huge bathroom and that's about where the compliments end. It was so tired looking and could be such a beautiful room. The furniture was pretty damaged and worse off than I could find at a garage sale. The comforter and blanket on the bed disgusted me. The front desk staff was friendly, the complimentary breakfast basic (but appreciated) and the location not bad. I wouldn't suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad....very bad !”
Reviews.Author: Ronald N
Reviews.Content: the only good thing is the location,the rest is an other story be ware of bed bugs in the room and rats in the garage

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good character”
Reviews.Author: Nuts4TravelSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good location right near Fenway Park and a subway stop. There are several restaurants nearby. I loved opening up the shutters and getting a view of the Green Monster from my room. It is an old hotel so it had character and charm. I had room that was a suite, an unexpected surprise. I expected some maintenance issues since this was an older hotel, but it would have been nice to close the bathroom door without slamming it. More lighting would have been good too. The room was dark and there were only two lamps. Staff was friendly and helpful. If you want to stay near downtown and the Freedom Trail, this may not be the best hotel to stay at. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sleighbow
Reviews.Content: Living in Chicago, I know what big city prices look like. However, I was a bit surprised to find a lack of affordable hotels when booking a trip to Boston this spring. That said, I really liked this hotel. Since I am someone who isn't looking for the lap of luxury when traveling, as I spend most of my time out on the town, this place was perfect. It has a great location, friendly staff, and a lot of character. I'll book the Buckminster again when returning to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean but needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: AndyandLiz
Reviews.Content: We spent four nghts at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the reception area was ok but the rest of the hotel was in need of modernisation. Our room had all the facilities you would need but the furniture was worn and dated and the bathroom was badly in need of a facelift. The hotel is located in a busy location and the traffic noise was quite bad but we didn't really expect it to be quiet. Breakfast was continental which was basic in a very boring and dimly lit room. The breakfast could have been laid out better as it was very cramped and caused unnecessary hold-ups. Also, bit disappointed we were charged for the Wifi and no tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place if you get certain rooms”
Reviews.Author: Luvocean3
Reviews.Content: Price was very reasonable. Location was at Kenmore Square and many things were in walking distance. The rooms we had were perfect for our group (see note on rooms). Could have used more lighting and outlets. Bathroom was a little on the shabby side. A typical continental breakfast was included. The layout of the breakfast was awkward which led to very slow moving lines although the breakfast eating area was very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Fenway out your window!”
Reviews.Author: mjteacher
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay close to the Red Sox stadium and at the Buckminister, we did!!!! We walked to the game and back! There was also a T very close by to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Internet Service Mars Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon1944
Reviews.Content: If the internet service at this hotel was as good as the staff this would be an excellent hotel. On our first visit there was not wifi in the room and someone had to come and find a broadband outlet which was hidden behind a heavy cabinet and move the cabinet and make the connection which left my netbook poorly placed for use. On our second visit there was no internet access of any kind in the room for eight hours which was a great inconvenience. It internet access is not important for you, this is a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: jandthud
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Buckminster is located in Kenmore Square in Boston which is near Fenway Park. The hotel location is good for anyone attending a ball game or concert at the stadium but may be bad if you want quite during these times. The hotel is located about a block from the T green lines B,C, and D station in Kenmore Square as well as a local bus terminal for the T. Also, I saw many Taxis hanging out in Kenmore Square. There are many restaurants and two convenience stores within Kenmore Square. The location isnâ€™t very close to many of the tourist and historic sites. The hotel is an older hotel but has been upgraded. I was very pleased with the quality of the accommodations as well as the staff. I stayed in an economy room which contained a full sized bed, regular sized bathroom with tub/shower, refrigerator/microwave, safe, desk, and wardrobe. Other than the bed only being a full sized bed, I would not have considered this an economy room and I have stayed in smaller rooms in New York City. Everything in the room was in working order and clean, however, there were some small areas of wear but I knew I wasnâ€™t paying for a perfect room. The staff at this hotel was awesome. Unless they were busy, they always greeted me upon my arrivals and departures every day I was there and were always eager to assist with whatever I needed. The maid staff always did a good job at cleaning my room. The hotel also offers loaner umbrellas at no charge when it rained. The continental breakfast was good and adequate. There are no hot entrees but there was more than just toast. They had apple or orange juice, 4 cereal choices, bagels, toast, mini muffins, Danish, coffee, milk (both whole and 2%), tea, and probably some more then I am forgetting. It was great to get breakfast to start your day. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I felt it was a good value compared to other options in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracey S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Buckminster for 3 days. The main purpose of our trip was a Red Sox game so the location could not be beat. When we checked in, I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly the front desk staff were. If you are looking for a hotel with straight lines and no character, then stay somewhere else. I LOVED the fact that the hallways were quirky and that the hotel had so much character! The room was a little on the small side but for just my hubby and I, it was fine. The bathroom was large, well lit and the shower was great. The bed was also super comfy. We had a newer flat screen TV in our room (room 314) Our room overlooked Fenway. We requested this and so while it was a little loud on game nights, it was well worth it and we expected it :) The front desk staff was amazing, always had great tips on where to eat and how to get anywhere in the city. They held our bags for us the day we checked out since our flight wasn't until 6pm. That was a nice feature. We didn't rent a car so parking wasn't an issue for us, but my advice is do not rent a car!! The T will get you anywhere you want to go, and you can get a 7 day unlimited ride pass for $15.00. It's a much better deal! The Buckminster is right off the Green line and easily accessible from the airport. If we make it back to Boston, we will definitely stay at the Buckminster!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mainetravelguy
Reviews.Content: Whenever my wife and I travel to Boston, we always stay at the Buckminster Hotel. It is close to the subway and right by Fenway Park. We never have trouble finding parking, although the hotel does charge a fee to park in their lot. The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful. Breakfast is even included. For a hotel in the middle of Boston, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good, the location is that matter”
Reviews.Author: crisdegani
Reviews.Content: If you look for a priceless hotel in Boston, I think is the only acessible option near than Copley Square and Kenmore Sq. My tip is that you ask for a room with a outside window, to get some fresh air, instead of internal rooms. It makes difference!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Seeing The Sox - Not Special Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: CTRedSox2004
Reviews.Content: Went 1st week in August to see the Red Sox play Cleveland and New York. The hotelâ€™s location make it very convenient for baseball fans. A couple minute walk to Fenway. That also makes it not so nice if you are not going to the game. Excepting the proximity to Fenway, this is an older, decent hotel. My room was very large with high ceilings and very tall windows. I was ok with the furnishings â€“ nothing special. The couch was not real comfy, TVâ€™s (2) were small with fuzzy reception and not many channels, carpets worn, window shutters worked but brokenâ€¦. Wi-Fi did not work in my room. I went to the front desk and they immediately gave me a cable, and did not charge for the internet. Parking is next door, $28 per day. DO NOT try to get to your car late at night. I had to drive to the airport @ 1:30 one morning for a family emergency. My car was in the lower level. There was no attendant. There were rats everywhere! I saw 10 â€“ 20 good sized rats. They didnâ€™t run & hide either. I had a small light on my key chain, so I could see them too well. Breakfast was disappointing, cold, blah limited section, nothing better than mediocre. The front desk and house keeping were better than the rest of the hotel. Stay if youâ€™re going to a game â€“ it is so close! But not otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: BobC211
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, efficient, large room, and convenient parking. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Fenway park, breakfast included, 2 rooms for our family... great!!”
Reviews.Author: hannibal22
Reviews.Content: We went here for a Red Sox game with a family of four and we just loved it. It's as close to the ballpark as you can get, we got 2 spacious rooms and breakfast was included (which was a standard American breakfast, but I've also been to more $$$ hotels where they do not serve you anything). Helpful staff, affordable parking in next-door garage. So I would go here again if I went to see the Sox. The T (Kenmore) is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly noisy, shabby and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: ChristineMargaret
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the main intersection of Mass. Ave., Commonwealth Ave, Brookline Ave, 60 feet away from I-90 and 100 yards from one of the main gates of Fenway Park. There were 3 major ball games in 4 days. The noise, traffic and crowds were awful. People on the top row of Fenway Park could look directlyy into our bedroom. Garbage everywhere on the streets. Vomit and garbage outside next to the hotel entrance columns that took them 2 days to clean up This is NOT a "dog friendly" hotel. When we arrived we were very suprised to find they charge a fee of $75 per dog which is hidden three layers down on their website and had not been mentioned on the phone. They made us sign a long contract regarding the dogs and you can never leave them unattended in the room. The room ... when we arrived the safe was broken, light bulbs out in the main ceiling fixture, the sink in the bathroom was backed up, the wooden shutters were broken, the carpet was grimey. Nothing was fixed despite request. We also discovered that the refridgerator was actually a freezer because it froze our yogurt and milk rock solid and the bedside clock radio was broken. It seems almost petty to mention that the TV was so small you practically needed binoculars to see it from the bed and naturally they are too cheap to put three-way bulbs in three-way bedside fixtures. They made a mistake on our reservation (making it for 3 rather than 4 nights). I discovered this on the afternoon of the 3rd day and the desk manager began to cop an attitude with me when I tried to expl,ain to her what was wrong with the room. She suggested that I leave immediately if I was so unhappy (who wouldn't be?), but I didn't have a choice because my husband was at a conference. Naturally no apology was forthcoming about the mistake in the reservation, they just canceled our room keys without telling us so we had to go up and downstairs to the front desk twice trying to get into our room where our belongings were. You couldn't pay me to stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not so excellent value”
Reviews.Author: patriciabc2010
Reviews.Content: Located steps from the Kenmore T stop and across the street from Fenway Park, you're definitely paying for location at this hotel. There are tons of restaurants and bars in easy walking distance. Rooms were clean and comfortable, but very small and awkwardly shaped. Ours also had no overhead lighting. Also, the hotel was absolutely freezing. We stayed in August and the temperature in our room was set to 68, which is a little ridiculous. What a waste of resources! We checked in and that is what the thermostat was set to- we turned it off and it was still cool all evening and then the next day the housekeepers had turned the AC back to 68 while we were out! Rather self defeating for a hotel that has signs about conserving water towels and has 'eco-friendly' shampoo and bar soap. Hotel staff was knowledgeable, professional, and friendly and held our bags for us for the day after we had checked out. They lend out umbrellas as well- a nice service considering Boston's, shall we say, capricious weather. There is also a complimentary continental breakfast, which we didn't take advantage of so I can't comment on. Was a pleasant experience, but not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet place to stay if you are a "Sox" fan”
Reviews.Author: judithamato
Reviews.Content: Parking available with discount, walk across the street to Fenway, and Bleachers bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if you are going to a Sox game!!!”
Reviews.Author: Threeoneseven
Reviews.Content: I love the Buckminster. Rooms are small but very clean. Thisclose to Fenway park which I love. Would totally stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Tracy121
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to watch a game at Fenway Park. Its location is the best and closest to the park. It served the purpose of proximity, cleanliness, and comfort. It was not deluxe by any stretch of the imagination, but the front desk staff was so helpful and courteous which helped to make up for few of the missing amenities . There was no coffee pot in the room with complementary coffee for the morning. I like that as a feature in a hotel room. I don't want to go down 6 floors with no make up and straight out of bed just to get a morning cup of coffee. The Fenway park view from my room was awesome though and it was neat to open up the window and hear the sights, sounds and smells of the pregame festivities. I would definitely stay again if going to a game.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Out Door Lover Us
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Boston before and really didn't know where to stay. We took a shot in the dark with the Buckminister. To say the least we were very pleased with the selection. The front desk staff was great! We were greeted with a warm smile (nice to weary travelers) and even given an upgrade to a two bedroom suite. I believe that the attendants name was Gary. We walked to Fenway Park. Great location and good price!

Reviews.Title: “Historic building, clean rooms and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: allisonjaynes
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, old hotel in the heart of Fenway park district. We stayed here one night and went to see the parks and the Gardner museum the next day. Parking was very reasonably priced ($28 overnight until check-out) and right next to the hotel. The staff was friendly and the building and room were gorgeous. That being said, it is an OLD building so it won't have the fancy, modern look that some people prefer. Also, the hot water took quite a bit of time to make it to our room - we had to run the tap for about 15 minutes to get it flowing at first. But the staff said that was normal and were very helpful about it. I also really appreciated the microwave and mini-fridge in the room. The Buckminster is a slice of history in an area that is gentrifying quickly - I recommend a stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melissa338
Reviews.Content: We needed to be in a good location in the city of Boston, but most of the hotels were too pricey. Then I found this hotel. The price was reasonable and the location looked good. You wonder when a hotel is below the price of its neighbors, but we couldn't afford not to try this. What a happy surprise! They call themselves a budget hotel, but it didn't feel like a budget hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful.The hotel itself is modern enough, but still has the charm of an earlier era. The room, which they upgraded for reasons I don't understand but sure appreciated, was lovely. The bed was really comfortable. We had a suite, which meant a couch and a small table and chairs for two, in addition to the bedroom and bath. There was ample storage and a guest laundry on another floor. The best part was being so close to everything. From our window, we could see Fenway Park, baseball fans. We were within a few steps from the subway station at Kenmore Square. There were many restaurants nearby, at least 6-8 on that corner alone. Boston University was just across the street, as was the Barnes & Noble that serves as their bookstore. The breakfast was served the sushi restaurant just off the lobby. At street level facing the corner was an Uno's restaurant which serves super pizza. I can't think of a better place for the "budget" visitor in Boston. I will try to think of reasons to visit Boston again just so I can stay at the Buckminster!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Value”
Reviews.Author: lives4cookies
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston at check in time and found the Front Desk staff to be friendly, helpful and welcoming. We drove in, so we also needed to park our car somewhere, when I booked online both of their websites stated that parking was $20 however when we paid for the parking they charged us $28. It was conveniently located in the parking garage directly behind the hotel which was very convenient and we also paid an additional $11 to stay passed noon in the garage till 6pm which we didn't mind for the next day. Our room was huge! we had a bedroom and then a separate bathroom which was in our room entrance but across a hall, it was like a small apartment. There was a nice tv, and microwave in the room too. Our bed was surprisingly comfy, sometimes in budget hotels the beds are less than to be desired but we slept great. You can tell the building is old but it is very clean & comfortable. After arriving in our room the front desk even called up to our room to make sure we had everything we needed and our room was acceptable. Breakfast as others have stated is very basic, coffee, tea, juice, milk, cereal, bagels, mixed pastries but these days alot of hotels are not giving a free breakfast so we thought it was just perfect for the money we paid to stay. The location of this hotel was perfect for us, one block away from Fenway park, 20 minute walk to the mall, and to get to Fenuil Hall and the harbor Front the subway is a 2 minute walk to the T line which will take you everywhere! We love Boston and we now love this hotel and will be staying there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time in the shadows of Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: dogman22
Reviews.Content: This is going to become my new home away from home! Stayed here for four nights in early July (including July 4th). Check in was easy, got a double room on the 6th floor. So close to Fenway Park (major plus for a huge Red Sox fan) that I felt I could throw a baseball onto the Green Monster from my room!! There's a Uno Chicago Grill in the same building, plus more restaurants close (or, for those who prefer fast food, a McDonald's over the road and Popeye's next door), and an awesome burger joint called uBurger just a three minute walk away. Kenmore T station is right there as well. Room was exactly what I needed - comfy bed with a good shower (and good toiletries as well). Looking forward to going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Red Sox fans!”
Reviews.Author: sonja121187
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times and it is always my first choice when going to Boston, especially to see a Sox game. It is walking distance from Fenway and even has window views of the park. The service is always amazing. The front desk staff are friendly and accommodating. I even forgot my camera and they had it shipped out to me that same day!! As for the price you can't get hotels for this cheap anywhere else unless they are trashy. The Buckminster is NOT! It is old but its charming. I love it and will use it every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: opac_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Buckminster Hotel for a week in order to attend a workshop at MIT. It was graduation week and all the hotels in Cambridge were booked, so had to look for an alternative outside Cambridge. The Buckminster hotel is a reliable choice, in a wonderful location. Next door to Fenway park if you are a baseball fan (I'm not), and only a leisurely 20 minute stroll away from Cambridge, with great views of the Charles basin on the way. Although rooms are basic, they are more than adequate: clean, quiet and comfortable. Also, you have 100 minutes of free internet a day, an increasingly rare amenity these days. Finally, staff were very attentive and ready to offer advice on the area or meet any specific demands. Great choice for the value-conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: glanzerr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Boston for three nights to see a Red Sox game and do some other sightseeing. I had never been to Boston before and really had no idea about hotels, but I kept coming back to the Hotel Buckminster. I had read some very mixed reviews on TripAdvisor and was a little hesitant going in, but the price was right and location couldn't be beat, so we gave it a shot. We were expecting an old, archaic type building but were pleasantly surprised to see the inside was quite modern and welcoming. The front desk staff was extremely pleasant and helpful and we were granted our request for a room facing Fenway Park! The room was perfect, far beyond what we anticipated after reading some other reviews on here. The view was great and the room was clean, cool, and comfortable. We were happy to have a fridge and microwave in the room as well. It also benefited us to have a laundry room with coin-operated washer/dryer right next to our room as we were in need of doing laundry. The location was great, literally right across the street from Fenway Park, and within a block of the Kenmore subway station. There were a lot of great bars and restaurants right within walking distance. The price was reasonable considering other options in the area. I think we paid $545 for 3 nights. I can't really think of any complaints or anything negative at all. The continental breakfast was a little weak, but adequate. Overall great experience. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Boston...especially for a Red Sox fan!”
Reviews.Author: MetroVancouver11
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic. Even before we got there I needed to make a change to our reservation and they were wonderful over the phone. I also emailed them about a question about their cribs and they responded right away. It is less than a 5 min walk to Fenway Park and if you have a room with a view of Fenway Park you can hear the fans cheering which we loved. The beds were very comfortable and the whole building was well maintained. It was a great value and this is the only place I will stay next time we go to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff.. ALL Departments”
Reviews.Author: kaymarie1983
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is Outstanding in customer service and friendliness. The hotel itself is a very old property, with all the quaintness and charm of a historic building. The room was fairly basic, no frills, but good sized. Nice refrigerator and microwave for convenience, but no coffee maker. Only one electrical outlet besides one in the bathroom, so charging personal electronics was a challenge. The bed was super comfortable. This is a great location, just a few steps away from the Kenmore station, Boston University and Fenway Park. What the rooms lacked, the staff more than made up for. I can overlook a few minor items, as long as I'm treated well. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Fenway and House of Blues”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDavePhilly
Reviews.Content: Not a fancy or modern hotel. Perfect if you are catching a game or hitting a concert. Near great bars and restaurants. Price is great too. It's a little expensive to park in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “only 90 minutes free internet”
Reviews.Author: oysterman60
Reviews.Content: hotel was pretty good for the outrageous prices they charge in Boston. Clean and cozy but a little small. Breakfast is your standard continental with coffee, juice, muffins and raisin bran, etc, no hot food except by microwave. My complaint was the internet. They advertise free internet but that is only for 90 minutes. Free should be free. They should say "90 minutes free internet"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation and breakfast for very convenient price”
Reviews.Author: Argentine-tourist
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Buckminster for 5 nights. We are budget travellers who appreciate comfort while trying to keep costs down. The Buckminster was the best deal in our US trip this year. For US $ 103 we got an ensuite 2 twin bed room with fridge and microwave plus an all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast. I simply do not understand all the complaints and fuss about a stain in the carpet. This is what I would call a perfect budget hotel, providing all a traveller needs. It is true that the furnishings are old fashioned and that the place would look much better and cost much more if it were completely refurbished, but from my point of view, let it be as it is. And the conveniences! We had a kitchen with an ice dispenser on the same floor, as well as a complete laundry room with washing and drying machine (a vending machine provides soap and softener). The room had a safe in the closet, a hair dryer in the bathroom (immaculately clean, all white), the room was well lit as there were large windows. The mattresses were comfortable. Towels were changed daily and room was always clean. Breakfast did not include cooked fare, but consider that it is a complimentary breakfast. Bagels, English muffins, Danish pastry, mini-cup cakes, four types of cereal, marmelades, honey, Philadelphia cheese , tea, cocoa, coffee, fresh fruit, orange and cranberry juice. A grill to toast bagles and muffins. I would not call that "little variety". Sure, if you are staying a month it might turn repetitive, but at that price, you can save enough to purchase whatever you want to add to the basic breakfast. We even saw guests who helped themselves to fruit and coffee and took it upstairs to their room. As regards service, this is the only hotel where we were greeted by our surname upon returning from sightseeing. So much so, that the second day I decided to memorize the name of the fellow who had taken the trouble to know who we were and where we were from. Thank you, Scott. We had trouble with the heating and the temperature in our room dropped to 61Âº. We asked the situation be looked into, and reception promised to send the maintenance crew. However, that night the room was still cold. A different receptionist took our second complaint and this time someone did their job right, because the room was steaming when we returned. The business center is rather expensive but very convenient: you access it with your card key and use your credit card to buy internet connection time. There are two work stations and the chairs are comfortable. There are several restaurants within a 2 block radius (two in the same building as the hotel). Although there is a convenience store which sells pizza and other simple fare round the corner, the supermarket is a good 12-minute walk away. As regards location, although it is not in the heart of Boston, it is a 12/15-minute ride away on the green T-line. The station is Kenmore and it is 100 yards from there to the hotel. A word of warning to future guests: there are 4 green trains coming out of Boston center: only B (to Boston College), C (to Cleveland Circle) and D (to Riverside) take you to Kenmore. If you get on the E line, you never reach Kenmore because it turns south towards Heath. Going inwards, into town, all the trolleys stopping at Kenmore follow the same route so you can hop on the first one that stops. There are elevators that take you up to street level without having to lug your suitcases up the stairs. At Park Street you can transfer to the red T-line. With those two lines, you can move all over Boston, Harvard and MIT. We got a Charlie one-week Pass with unlimited trips for US$ 15 each. It works out even if you are staying only 4 days! Summing up, don't hesitate to book this place if you are cost conscious but want comfort and convenience. Don't stay here if you are fussy about style and decor and can afford to pay 200 dollars a night for lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SeanJA
Reviews.Content: While the "Buck" is an old guy, it was clean, the bed comfy and clean, the bathroom was cleaner than more expensive places I have stayed (and the water was hot and plentiful). The desk folks were amazingly polite, smart, and helpful. Great location to BU and to Fenway. Best deal on sushi right in the hotel. They are working on some remodeling which made a few hallways dusty, but that did not encroach into the rooms. Plus, it'll be even better when they are done. I saw another person had an issue mere days before I was there. Quite frankly, I think that person is crazy. I stayed 12 nights and when I return to Boston, I'll stay there without hesitation. Bring an ethernet cable for free internet. (That's a secret)

Reviews.Title: “THEY RIPPED ME OFF!”
Reviews.Author: jkd2333
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk couldn't do a simple credit card transaction and charged me $66 too much.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: xtremequad
Reviews.Content: Dirty, Dirty, Dirty and old. Stains on wall, floor, and dirty bathroom. Could use a major remodeling. Parking situation is also horrible....not very many spots and in a very sketchy lot. Location is the only thing this place has going for it...

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with great value, very cozy”
Reviews.Author: frenzee617
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Buckminster is more of a budget hotel than a luxury or high end. However, that doesn't mean the accomodations are sub par at all. Upon arriving I found the lobby to be tasteful and welcoming. Front desk staff were very courteous and accomodating. My room was on the third floor. It was a bit small, but having stayed in a lot of hotels in Boston and New York City, this is pretty typical for older hotels (this one dates from the late 1800s). The room, including bathroom, the bed, carpeting and furniture were clean. It was a little warm for my taste, and an older-style thermostat on the wall didn't really help much. Luckily the windows open, so I opened it a crack and the fall/winter air cooled it down to my satisfaction. Pros: -Location, right on subway line, close to fenway, back bay -Price: very inexpensive compared to other larger chain hotels -Everything was clean and housekeeping staff were friendly and thorough -Comfortable bed -Ipod docking station -Refrigerator and microwave! -Laundry facility -Continental breakfast Cons: -Older style TV -Small room -A little outdated decor -Thin towels, not many toiletry accomodations -Hard to adjust temperature All in all, I paid under $100 a night, which is a steal, even for the slow winter season. I found that the pros of this budget hotel much outweigh the handful of cons, and for the location, price, and cozyness, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying a casual weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Still there, still great value”
Reviews.Author: WalnutStreet
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my British fiance to see my old college-town during Easter. I was happy to see the Buckminster in good shape offering excellent value for its handy location right in Kenmore Square. It is a well-maintained older boutique hotel with an interesting layout winding around a curving building. The associated Japanese restaurant has always offered excellent breakfast (included I believe) and the dinner sushi, etc. is good as well. We ventured out all over Boston with the Buckminster as our base. Cabs are easy to find, subway is right there, we easily walked to Newbury Street and onwards to the Common/Boston Public Gardens, Chinatown, Fanieul Hall, North End, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- rooms need renovation”
Reviews.Author: thomaspaine
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel but not strongly. The location in Kenmore Square was next to the T. The location is perfect and the cost of the hotel for downtown boston was quite good. However the shower was industrial and not very nice. The decor is nice and boutique like but the floor is disgusting looking with large stains.It was unbelievably hot when i was going to bed and I woke up in a sweat. Also the generator outside my window made it impossible to open a window because of the noise. And the temperature could not be adjusted without damaging the heating unit according to an old hand written not taped above the thermometer. That was a nice surprise at 1 in the morning when i was looking forward to a good nights sleep after a night on the town. If a few updates are made this would be a beautiful hotel. Also , the the staff in the morning were some rather obnoxious women, not friendly and rather bothersome. The fellows working at night were quite kind and inviting, a stark difference between these two teams of workers. Also you only get 90 minutes of WIFI a day in your room, and its incredibly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: ce_interiors
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, good quality hotel. Rooms were a little smaller than expected but very liveable considering we were in Boston to site see. 3 Mins walk from Fenway Stadium and various bars in the precinct. 3 mins walk to subway and a good walk to Aubrey Street and Boston Common. Breakfast each morning was simple but it worked. Would happily stay there again as rooms were extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, close to "T" station”
Reviews.Author: j-ho_NI
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the cheapest hotels within easy travel distance from Boston downtown. Just beside Kenmore T station, comfortable and clean. A bit too close to the MassPike freeway, so depending on your room location, it might be a bit noisy. Parking is expensive, but that's usual for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Loubyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Boston hotels are notoriously expensive and this was the best deal we could find (on Expedia). The room was unexciting initially but clean and comfortable and spacious for a hotel which seemed to be a labyrinth of corridors. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly and the complementary continental breakfast was very good (kept fully restocked and fresh). The hotel is next to Fenway park (Boston Red Sox home ground) with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby (within walking distance). It's also close to a T stop (the underground) and bus stops so easy to get into the main tourist areas. It's also easy walking distance to most places in the guidebooks. As a rough guideline - you can walk to Copley Square in ~15 minutes, ~25 minutes walk to Boston Public Gardens and the Freedom Trail and in ~25-30 minutes to the Aquarium and Quincy Market. And it's a nice walk! p.s. do a Duck Tour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but could do with a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: threehousestwopools
Reviews.Content: I know that it is one of the oldest hotels in Boston so understand that it is not brand spanking sparkly. The lobby is very attractive but the bedrooms could do with a lick of paint and new carpets and sad that pipes run across ceiling. The front desk staff were all very charming and helpful so absolutely no criticism there. The complimentary breakfast was fine but the waste involved in using paper/plastic disposable plates and cutlery strikes me as very wasteful and unnecessary. For baseball lovers it must be heaven as it overlooks Fenway Park. Very conveniently located for Boston sightseeing but make sure you get off at the correct subway stop, we got off at the wrong one and had a long walk. Incidentally their public transport system is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: michelleka7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing great service clean rooms and right next to fenway park. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location great staff fun place.... european feel”
Reviews.Author: lerlerler
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Boston and wanted to take my kids back to visit. Great location if you want subway adjacent - not IN the heart of Boston but reasonable priced and a block from the T. If you like a sterile Hilton-type hoewl? Not it! It's funky and old with a great staff, free breakfast and a mini kitchen on every floor. Kind of an old european feel. In fact many of the guests were from Europe. They price matched one of those pre pay websiyes and THEN upgraded my room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bindi42
Reviews.Content: Great location, the free continental breakfast was such a bonus and included toast, cereals, fruit and pastries. A taxi is about $15 to great into the centre of Boston / Long Warf. Uno's Grill is a great place to eat, good value for money and a large choice. There is a 7 eleven down the road and the hop on hop off trolley picks up at Fenway park which is virtually next door. The staff are extremely helpful and the business centre has good internet access for a fee. There is onsite laundry at total cost for a large load including drying and powder is $5 (quarters needed). This is a hidden gem with large rooms, including microwave and fridge, however there are no tea and coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ElmaNYBoston
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Buckminster 4 times and have never been disappointed. It is 5 minutes from the "T" which can take you all over Boston. Never needed a car. Lots of restaurants in walking distance, The staff is always willing to help and the free breakfast is just right. Price is great compared to most of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar, great location, quaint, adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: Berger925
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews before booking my stay, some were negative but I booked it anyway. This hotel could not have been better, we have stayed at the Howard Johnson most of my visits in the past. The Buckminster puts them to shame I will stay at this hotel at all my visits from now on. The rooms were very nice. The elevator is a bit small but that was not a problem. If you go to a hotel for the size of the evevator then stay home. The staff was very professional and seamed as they really cared about my stay. The rooms were clean and well stocked. We could see the green monster from my room. I think for my experience this hotel was under charging for our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Fenway Fans, so-so rooms...”
Reviews.Author: joshlufsgirl
Reviews.Content: The only reason I really gave this hotel three stars is for the location. my husband and I are Red Sox Nation Citizens and we were going to use our 'free' (relatively speaking...they come with the cost of membership) tickets to go see a game there last week with friends. Fifteen years ago my husband fondly remembered staying at the Buckminster, so for that reason, we ended up there. Of course I did my homework, and researched it on here. Generally we stay at Marriotts or high-end boutique properties, so I was a little leery about his selection of the Buckminster. Reviews were pretty varied, but I will echo the sentiment that this hotel needs serious updating. The elevators are small and old, the rooms (while large in size) were also old. The paint was an unflattering peach color which clashed with the purple floral bed covers and the green (i think) carpets. We sprung for a two bedroom suite and in our main room there were two bay style windows that overlooked Fenway. Great view, but when we opened the window to get some fresh air in, we were pretty shocked to discover that one of them was missing a screen. Being on the fifth floor in a room most likely used by families I thought this was unsafe and unacceptable. The bathroom was clean, although the fixtures appeared to be a bit outdated. All in all, I would not return to this hotel. Bed linens are pretty important to me, and I really like the all white duvet, triple sheet-ed look of some of the other main chain hotels or boutiques. The front desk staff, namely a gentleman named Whitney were stellar though. They deserve to be working somewhere that is a bit higher caliber. The breakfast in the morning was a nice touch as well, something that many american travelers aren't used to seeing offered complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories”
Reviews.Author: SBA67
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3 day trip to Boston over the 4th of July. We loved the Buckminster and would without a doubt stay there again. Of course, it didn't hurt that my son and his family had the green monster as their view and my oldest grandson opened the window listened to the crowd as he watch the game on TV our first night. It was close to restaurants, the subway, the Charles River, everything we wanted. The staff was absolutely great and the rooms while old, were very clean and we had plenty of hot water for showers. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the savings.”
Reviews.Author: 9oaks
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Boston are expensive. Finding a reasonably priced hotel takes some effort. I thought I would try this one - from the website it looks really historic and nice. It is...on the outside. The inside, however, is a disaster. Dangerously old elevators....cramped, spooky hallways....and filthy rooms. The type in which you don't want to walk barefoot. I would sleep on a bench in Boston Common before I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: bchamb
Reviews.Content: Their wireless internet was straight up broken on my entire wing of the hotel. They charge for everything, including internet, which I paid for and was not refunded in spite of it failing. Bathtub faucet spit brown crap for about a half hour before it would work and I was forced to just hope no more came out because I had a job interview. But the absolute worst of all is that it has been 80 degrees in my room this entire trip because their FREAKING AC DOESN'T WORK. Do not stay here. It is incredibly, horribly miserable.

Reviews.Title: “The "Bucky"”
Reviews.Author: dianl3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 times over the last 4 yrs.... It's not fancy, but the location can't be beat,. If you have a kid at B.U. the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, quirky character and tons of charm”
Reviews.Author: mahoagany
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel, especially for travelers who want to stay downtown for a reasonable price. The service staff was consistently stellar-recommended restaurants, gave directions and held our baggage until check-in time. Other reviews have mentioned that the amenities/furnishings are not up to date, and that's correct. However, it's nothing serious. The beds were super-comfortable and the kitchenette and bathroom were clean. We loved our Fenway view and there was great atmosphere on game nights. The hotel is close to transportation and restaurants. One tip--it seems as though the air conditioning must be turned on by the front desk staff in order for the room thermostat to work. We called down to the front desk on the two occassions when the AC didn't seem to be working and they had it back working within 5 minutes. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend the Buckminster. The staff alone is reason enough to book, but the hotel also has great charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awful Sleep”
Reviews.Author: jabouch
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a place to drop your things right next to Fenway, it's perfect. If you want to sleep, it's awful. The king bed we had in our room would have been more comfortable to sleep on if it had a top layer of wood to soften it. SOOOOO uncomfortable & hard. When we got to the room it was very hot and stuffy so I asked them to turn the air on, once it was on - it wouldn't go off! It turned into an icebox. The control in the room had no control over the temp! The overall cleanliness of the room was poor. I wouldn't walk barefoot in there. The 2 TV's in our room were the old box style and very small, and our room was an upgrade! I can only imagine what the original room was like! The inside of this hotel desperatley needs updating. Definately NOT worth the price they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Old Hotel. Needs updating badly.”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot65
Reviews.Content: First the good things. *Location. Location. Location. *Beautiful exterior & lobby *Friendly & helpful staff *Did I mention location? Not so good. *Not clean - need to keep shoes or socks on in the room. Yuck. Time for new flooring. *No A/C - at all. It was hot. We had to open windows which made it loud because of 24 hour traffic and there are no screens so bugs came in. *The rooms haven't been updated in at least 15 years - linens or furniture. *Many technical problems. One TV needed repairs to work at all. One didn't get lower channels at all. Hall lights in our suite didn't work. Some of the wall plugs didn't work so finding a place to charge a cell phone was a challenge. Lastly, if you make a reservation here, get a person's name & a confirmation #. Make sure they email it to you and bring the email with you. They lost our reservation and they were full. I had to bully my way into them giving us a room. Luckily I had the name of the girl who made the reservation and my non-working confirmation #. Best place to stay for a Red Sox game - only 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden "Old Boston" gem with awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: debtfreeinjuly
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston for a consult at the Children's Hospital and decided to make the trip more fun for my 9yo son. What drew me to the Buckminster was the price (on-line deal of $88) and that it was so close to the T. Parts do appear to be in various phases of renovation. This did not take away from the "Old Boston" charm. The room was more than adequate, the breakfast was very good, and most importantly the the customer service was superior. The clerk even called our room about 15 minutes after we go there to see how my son liked the view. Our room looked right out onto the Green Monster. As a mom traveling with a young child, I felt very safe there. They went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. My only complaint is that the room was very warm and we could not control the temp. We opened the window for a little while and it was fine. The clerk said I could have just called and they would have lowered it from there. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience-BUT!”
Reviews.Author: pmeun69023
Reviews.Content: The 'BUCKY' has great ambiance. The other guests we met were friendly. The staff were all great and very helpful. The parking was impossible but the staff made it possible and easy - and that was a real feat for them. I gave a good tip and it was well deserved. If you are in town for a Red Sox game this is a great location. WALKING DISTANCE - NO LIE!! We had a room just opposite the GREEN MONSTER-- not your everyday experience!! The rates were good for being right in Kenmore Square. SO!!! What is the (slight) rub? Well, the air conditioning didn't work and the room was a tad uncomfortable. I am glad it was not June, July or August. It might have been a disaster. Call ahead and be sure the A/C is working BEFORE booking. The 'in room' mini 'fridge didn't work well.
