The continental breakfast leaves something to be desired. This IS a hotel we WILL return to, and gladly so. I just hope the Red Sox whip up on the Yankees next time like they did our Angels May 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: solojess
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a month of staying in hostels. I walked in and was greeted by a smile by the front desk staff, Got up to my room and was happy with the room size, the bathroom was massive!! the room had a t.v and microwave which was great for someone on a budget to save on eating out( there is a 7 11 just down the street to pick up some good mircowave meals) The room was cleaned daily and the cleaning staff where really nice. ( i was leaveing my room one day and run in to a clean who politly asked if it was alright if she cleaned my room now) I probably had my best sleep of all my travel here, which was great prep for more hostel travel after boston.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY WARM, HOSPITABLE AND A REFRESHING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: AnnuK16
Reviews.Content: My check-in was past midnight yet I was greeted with a smile, they seemed all prepared and keys were made available immediately. I felt welcomed after 22 hours of traveling. The room was spotlessly clean. Next morning the front desk and all staff were gracious guiding me to my destination. Surprisingly I had booked through an overseas call. The General Manager Mr. Jonathan E. Colter is a thorough gentleman. He guides his staff to proficiency. My observation about the Hotel Staff was that they are courteous and extremely accommodating to each ones needs. Having traveled widely I would say this stay was one of the most enthralling and relaxing of all experiences. The breakfast is the best start for the day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jac831
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston for a Red Sox game. Nice affordable hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, staff was very friendly and was very helpful with info on getting around Boston. The hotel is in a great location, so close to Fenway Park!

Reviews.Title: “I don't think I would call it 'old world charm'...”
Reviews.Author: bettyapple
Reviews.Content: I need to preface this by saying 95% of the time we go to B and B's so I think I have been spoiled when it comes to enjoying hotels. I didn't feel any old world charm! We only stayed one night so didn't have time to interact with people too much but the staff was very nice- helpful and accommodating. The continental breakfast was good and the women attending to the food were nice also. No problems with the staff. But the room sorta skeeved me out. Everything is well worn out- rug-dirty brown around the edges- crusty tiles in bathroom- the bed was what you would see at your grandma's way outdated house and color schemes and patterns were just all wrong.. unpleasant to look at- creamsicle walls with dark (dingy?) maroon checked rug with all wrong colors on the bedspread and dimly lit room (so you can't see the imperfections?).... just couldn't get into it. (Note pictures). I do like that they use the 'green' soap and shampoos. Loved the soap! to not waste the middle- don't have one! we most likely won't go back. I would only recommend this to people who want to go to Fenway Park.. since it is practically next door.

Reviews.Title: “Beware... Mattress equals a backache !!”
Reviews.Author: jimmythecop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the famous Buckminster Hotel in the past, I love the history of the Hotel, the fact that it faces the "Green Monsta" at Fenway Park, if requested as we did. Yes, there is a bit of street noise...you are real close to Boston University. Ther area is goregeous... Public garden down the street etc ... The room? ok .... very clean, kitchenette, 2 t.v's. The problem? Well, the bed sagged in the middle and was intolerable. It was noticed about 3 am as we were woken with unreal back pain. I brought this to the attention of the clerk the next morning. her response? " Well, we are replacing the mattresses room by room. My reply " So, at that reat, it will be 2013 until all rooms are done ?" Well, her look alone could have killed. My next comment was " I'm going to trip advisor to notify others of the lousy mattresses." Her reply" You gotta do whatcha gotta do" Well... there ya go ... lousy RERPONSE !! The hotel is nice, clean. The location is great. The matresses suck and they DO NOT APOLOGIZE FOR THAT ... NOT EVEN CLOSE !!

Reviews.Title: “The Service and Management are Terrible!! Don't ever Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed79
Reviews.Content: I think that since they are so close to Fenway they don't feel the need to provide quality customer service. I have tried to call and speak with management, on a pending matter, I get no returned call. Not to mention that the supervisor was very rude and really didn't care that her customers were unhappy. It's all about quantity with them and not quality. I am very very disappointed in this hotel, and would NEVER recommend it to anyone! I believe that the customer is always right! This hotel does not take pride in that! They will be loosing so much business from our corporation.

Reviews.Title: “So Excited to Find this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: summerrhi
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal on a suite and was nervous that it was too good to be true. It was not! We had a great weekend and the location was great! There were a few minor problems - the room was a bit cold and the bathroom was hot so we propped the door open to even things out. Also the walls are kind of thin. The staff was super friendly and helpful as well. Would definitely recommend and stay here again in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Darling hotel”
Reviews.Author: KgirlNH
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Buckminster for the first time, and weâ€™re already planning to go back. The location is great â€“ right next to Fenway and just steps from Kenmore Station. The hotel is classic vintage and although they have updated the amenities, it retains its vintage charm through its curving marble staircases and gilded moldings. The rooms are of average size, the bathrooms on the small side but impeccably clean and decked out in marble. The beds have firm mattresses and lots of fluffy pillows. Thereâ€™s a fridge and microwave in every room, and a lavish continental breakfast is included. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful. The price couldnâ€™t be beat. Donâ€™t expect a cookie-cutter chain hotel, but if a beautifully-maintained vintage sounds like your kind of place, then youâ€™ll love the Buckminster.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location for the SOXs games”
Reviews.Author: NHFamof4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and everything in it is old. But the location is key for SOX's games. We put up to 8 PPL in a two bedroom suite. You can't beat the price for downton Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Character and Charm”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL_LOVER96
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel for the character it had. It was old! As old as Fenway Park, to be exact. The age of the hotel added to the fun of the stay honestly. The hotel on one side is steps from Fenway and all the pre game hang outs and on the other side has a huge selection of all kinds of great restaurants and lounges. Other then the cheering on game nights, the hotel is very quiet! Even the cheering didn't bother us, it was great! The underground subway terminal is with in steps of the front door and so unbelievably easy to use to get around the city!! There are no frills, just clean, comfortable, affordable sleeping quarters, in a great location for accesss to everything, with some charming old character to go with it! Breakfast is included and is simple with a great selection of items. Would go back and would also recommend to everyone! We really enjoyed everything Boston had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “dropkicking boston”
Reviews.Author: rockabillybetty
Reviews.Content: i go to Boston every year for st. patricks day/ well really for dropkick murphys shows, the buckminster is so close to the T and the avalon. and from the outside it was so kute!! oh and its right next to unos. but thats where all the good stuff stops the hall ways were so small. the room was big but had mold and smelled. i was so glad i took my own sheets. i will never stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, location, and service, but very basic amenities.”
Reviews.Author: CPFBaltimore
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Buckminster Hotel is its convenience. The hotel is located within spitting distance of Boston University, Fenway Park, House of Blues and the Kenmore Square T, and it's a decent, very pretty walk to Newbury Street, the Hynes Convention Center and the Prudential Tower. We visited Boston in late September, when the walking weather is at it's best, and it was a cinch getting around town. The service is top-notch, too - very friendly staff, attentive housekeeping, and when we had an issue with our room, someone was there within 10 minutes. On the flip side, do not expect too much of the room itself. You'll get what you need: a bed, a desk, a chair, a bathroom, and there was a microwave and minifridge in the room, as well. However, there was no coffee maker, a tiny 13-inch TV, and an extremely spotty internet connection. The hotel offers one hour of free internet per day at very slow speeds (one day we couldn't even load email) - any more time or speed, and you'll have to buy it. There are a number of free networks floating around - if you can catch one, I recommend using that instead. If all else fails, and you need to connect, there's a Barnes and Noble across the street. We can't complain too much - the price was outstanding for the convenience. I just wish we could have left the window open at night (the room overlooked the Turnpike as it feeds into Back Bay). The free breakfast is your typical continental - coffee, bananas, bagels and danish. I'd recommend heading over to Trident Books and Cafe on Newbury Street for breakfast, instead. It's packed on weekends, but quiet during the week, and their menu is awesome. I'm sure there are reviews here - check them out. All-in-all, if you're looking for a place to rest your head at night after a day of touristing, shopping, watching the Sox, or dropping your kid off at BU, the Buckminster is a pretty good choice. If you're looking for a romantic getaway or a place to get some work done, you're better off looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Parking lot NOT Secure”
Reviews.Author: NJ505newjersey
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Boston for one night -- attending a Red Sox game - prior to spending our vacation on Cape Cod. Prior to booking our stay, we inquired about parking and was told parking was available at a garage next store. We booked our stay at the Buckmister as we thought a garage would be more secure than a surface lot. Our car was broken into and items taken sometime during the night. Both the garage and hotel disclaim any responsibility. The parking garages policy of closing one hour after the game basically means the employees go home at such time NOT that the lot is secured. In fact no gates are closed, security cameras are facing backwards -- it does not appear that the garage takes reasonable care in protecting the overnight cars. The hotel claims that they simply reimburse the garage for the discount being given hotel guests and the hotel is not involved in the operation of the garage -- fair enough -- but it is very misleading for the hotel to represent that parking is nearby - when they know the parking is not secure overnight. They are a hotel -- they know the cars are going to be there overnight! I would not recommend anyone stay at the Buckmister if they are traveling with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: Astro07
Reviews.Content: The Good Right by the Kenmore stop on the Green Line of the T. Excellent location for Fenway Park. We went to a game and it was great being able to slip back into hotel and not have to battle with the crowds on the T. The continental breakfast was good. The Bad The room was very small and a bit of a strange shape, my boyfriend had to overlap the bathroom door with his case. The decor was very tired, and the bed was very hard. The Ugly The room was very hot and when we opened the window we found we were right by the extractor fans, it was incredibly noisy. We asked to move rooms on two occasions but unfortunately they were full. We didn't sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: marianst
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel because of the reviews here on this site. We had tickets to see the Red Sox and this hotel is almost across the street. The bed seemed small for a queen size but I slept better than my husband. We liked the breakfast and also the location to the T.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SoxandDoxfan
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Buckminster. I have no compliants. The staff was great, location is perfect, down the street from a T stop and Fenway Park. The building is old but everything is clean. Contenental breakfast in an attached restaurant. Print boarding pass for free. With AA discount it was $140. a night, not bad for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “You can stay here”
Reviews.Author: perrysgift
Reviews.Content: Nothing really to say about the Buckminster. It was fine. Yes the furniture is old and chipped, but it is very clean and reasonably well maintained. The walls are thin, but if you are just using this as a place to sleep while you tour the city, there is nothing that wrong with it. The temperature control (or lack there of) is the only major drawback; our room was warmer than we like it, but not uncomfortable. The breakfast is what you would expect: fruit, cereal, toast etc. Nothing warm (eggs, waffles etc.). The location is fantastic. This is not a luxury hotel by any stretch, but it is a clean, safe reasonably priced hotel two and a half minutes from Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Buckminster Hotel - It's a room, and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Following24
Reviews.Content: Just returned from visiting Boston - truly a wonderful city, especially in the fall. I booked my room through one of the online travel sites - the one that tells you where you're staying after you pay. My wife and I landed our room at the Buckminster Hotel. Pros - Location is excellent. Right next to Fenway Park and Kenmore Train Station. Lot's of great nightlife, safe place in the city, and good places to eat. I have to say that booking through a travel site, I was able to get a room here for $63.00 a night. That's a HUGE value in a good part of Boston. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly. Cons - Our room was about 12'x14' - I'm not exaggerating. The worst part is we did not have control of our thermostat. I called the front desk and told him I wanted to turn the air on - he told me they can turn it on from the outside of the room. Sure enough, 10 minutes later our air was working, however our thermostat still didn't work. After several hours of the air on full blast and the room becoming ice cold, I had to call the front desk and tell them to turm my air off. They made no apologies at all for this inconvenience and acted like this was acceptable. My wife was keeping me calm reminding me that all we needed was a bed and a shower and this place did provide that much. We had a great time in Boston and look forward going back in the spring. I will recommend this hotel with the understanding that if you need a bed and a shower and don't want to spend $250.00 and up per night for a room in Boston, then this place works.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled about the two bedroom suite on the 6th floor”
Reviews.Author: TabbyToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked one room for the two of us for two nights via Hotwire at an unbelievable low price, but then we ended up needing two double or queen sized beds because we had an extra person wanting to stay with us one of those nights. We called one day ahead and the staff was most accommodating and when we arrived we saw that we had been upgraded to a two room suite on the sixth floor at the same low price as just one room. We found both of the rooms clean and spacious and nicely furnished, one with a queen and one with a double bed, TV and fridge in both rooms. The breakfast was held in the Japanese restaurant on the ground floor and offered many choices i.e. cereal, oatmeal, muffins, bread/bagels, jams, cream cheese, peanut butter, coffee, and large selection of teas, baked items, and at least 4 different kinds of fruit. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is over 100 years old but still has charm and character, and it is literally across the street from Fenway Park and close to many amenities. We couldn't have been happier with our two nights at the hotel, it was a real treat!! We found free parking from 6 p.m. to 8 a.m. closeby, there is also paid parking across the street or in the nearby parking garage which can vary in price, but we were gone most of the day and had to feed parking meters in another part of the city from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Anywhere in Boston you have to pay for parking, it is the worst city for traffic congestion, one way streets, metered parking with lots of restrictions, and the city employs lots of people to keep an eye on those meters and give out tickets if any meter expires by even a second. Someone from out of town was ticketed while trying to find a quarter to feed the meter before it expired, but unfortunately came a few seconds too late.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NCSportsFan
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on an old hotel due to its proximity to Fenway Park. Was pleasantly surprised....very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and courteous staff. While the furnishings were not plush, they were adequate. A super value and the 2-3 minute walk to the ballpark was very convenient. Attending a ballgame at Fenway and staying at the historic Buckminster Hotel was like taking a step back in time....priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Its just okay”
Reviews.Author: shelb724
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with the staff or cleanliness of the room. The proximity to BU is amazing--I did not have to take the T to get to my daughter's dorm which was nice. However, one thing I had an issue with is that they advertise that there is free wireless for internet. It is free for one hour a day. After that, it is $10 a day. I am kind of surprised I didn't see that on any of the reviews here. And that $10 a day is for the basic internet, to get faster is $20 a day. Other than that, I had no other issues. Oh, and the 'business center' -- unless you are using the computer to print your boarding pass, there is a charge for that as well. I have found another place to stay at that does include wireless and is just better for me (only I do have to take the T to get to BU), but I can live with that.

Reviews.Title: “Fenway Park in our sights!”
Reviews.Author: zekesidney
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Trip Advisor and reluctantly decided to stay at the Buckminster anyway. The Buckminster is an older hotel that is less than a 5 minute walk to Fenway Park and to a T-Stop. We could see Fenway Park from our window. We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. We stayed in a one-bedroom, two room suite that had a king sized bed. Although the bathroom was a bit tiny, the suite was spacious and clean. The continental breakfast had cold cereal, bagels, assorted pastries and doughnuts, coffee and juice. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. The Buckminster is not a five-star hotel, but we enjoyed our stay there and will book a room there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ogb1972
Reviews.Content: We took a bit of a punt with this, booking it quickly through a tour company after a look at the website. The gamble paid off - good location - longish walk to town but right by Kenmore T stop. Staff very pleasant, room comfy and clean and bathroom great - one tip, ensure you make it clear you want a double bed not a double room, as you'll get two singles, although staff resolved the problem quickly. Fridge in room, good tv, safe for valuables, iron and ironing board, clock radio. Breakfast basic but tasty and unlimited, with a good mix ( fruit as well as pastries and bagels). Location meant that as well as it being good for exploring the city, it was also great for the baseball and for reaching the quieter, more local area around Coolidge corner, with its good selection of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great value and convenience”
Reviews.Author: hikerdogs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Buckminster twice in the last 3 weeks. Its location is perfect, a few minutes walk to Fenway and the T stop. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The hotel is old, but clean. I was very happy with both my stays, and think it is a very good value. We had no trouble with noise either stay. The only negatives are that the beds are very uncomfortable and the climate control is very limited. The room was a bit warm for me, but not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Fenway Park”
Reviews.Author: ocathainey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Buckminster for the monumental Red Sox game where Papi got his first homer of the season! The front desk personnel were welcoming and went out of their way to help in any way. We were also upgraded from a Queen room to King suite for the 139.00 price, with a great view of Fenway Park, you felt like you were there already! The suite was comfortable and the bed was very comforting after a long and tiring day.The location is perfect,and the hotel reminds me of many I've stayed in in Ireland, with the old world charm, winding hallways,shuttered windows, marble entrance, charming. I would stay again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: PatrickMcarthy
Reviews.Content: I was taking my son to a Red Sox game and wanted to find a hotel close to Fenway Park. I reserved a room at the Buckminster and was glad I did. It is virtually a 30 second walk to the park. Being so close to Fenway and the atmosphere that surrounds it was priceless. The hotel is older than Fenway, but has lots of character. We received a free upgrade at check-in to a room that had partial view of the park. Sure, the roomâ€™s furnishings and color scheme were a bit outdated. But, it was clean, comfortable and most of all, affordable. Our rate was $139, included a continental breakfast and discounted parking at only $18 a night (the garage was charging $40 to non hotel guests). We had a partial view of the park from our room, but some of the rooms had better views. What we enjoyed the most about this hotel was the staff at the front desk, they were genuinely friendly, welcoming and very helpful, and that contributed to a great trip! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “character and clean and efficient. great location with great value”
Reviews.Author: jskula
Reviews.Content: loved this place. great value with old time charm and can't beat location. plus it was clean and staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Professionally run.”
Reviews.Author: 2ba4
Reviews.Content: The cleanest, best operated place I have ever experienced. Convenient to attractions and subway. Terrific breakfast furnished. The room was not large, but was fine for the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Heart of Kenmore Square.”
Reviews.Author: QuinnyOA
Reviews.Content: The Buckminster Hotel has undergone extensive renovations recently and they have done a great job maintaining the historic character of the hotel while at the same time providing all the modern amenities you expect when traveling. It is only a 1 minute walk to Boston's public transportation system and just a short drive to all of Boston's tourist attractions. The hotel is across the street from Fenway Park and would be a great place to stay if you are going to see a Red Sox game. Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: BostonDesignteacher
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has been updated and has excellent and accommodating staff. The furnishings are old and rooms and suites oddly shaped, which adds a sort of quirky personality. Not for those who want pristine accommodations but clean and friendly. Good wi-fi. Beds can sometimes be overly firm, but the staff will switch out rooms if they have them. Crowded during baseball season since it's just across a small bridge from Fenway Park.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Visitor”
Reviews.Author: MickelsNana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Hotel Buckminster since 1987, first as the parent of a student in college nearby, and then after that as a passionate Red Sox Fan. While the hotel is undoubtedly one of the oldest in Boston, and probably does not have the same "snob" appeal as some others, that sets it apart from the generic modern hotel which could be in Atlanta, London or Berlin. It has it's own distinctive personality. The rates are reasonable. The staff are the friendliest I have ever encountered and no problem has ever gone unresolved. The present owners/managers have spent time and money modernising the hotel without taking away from its charm. While my visits are now Baseball related and the proximity to Fenway Park ideal, the location is great for virtually any visitor to Boston as it is minutes away from the "T" which provides transport to greater Boston. The Buckminster is well run, in a prime location, reasonable, safe and friendly. I always recommend it to anybody I know who is visiting Boston. Red Sox fan from Bermuda.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyc1967
Reviews.Content: OK, where should I start... OK I'll start with the only positive I can think of. The girl at the front desk was very nice when we checked in. She even had a good sense of humor, which is obviously very necessary at this joke of a hotel. Granted, this hotel is probably great for a drunken bunch of baseball fans after a Red Sox game because it is seconds from the ballpark, and they would probably be the only people tolerant of such a place, but for anyone sober, it is much too much to stomach. The room was over 80 degrees and you were unable to turn the heat down, and if you opted to open the window, it sounded as if you were sleeping on the highway below. My entire body and mouth were so dry by morning that i drank 4 glasses of water just to get rehydrated. As if that isn't enough, the bed was so hard that my boyfriend's back is still recovering from sleeping on a 25 year old mattress. We complained at the front desk about the heat and he told us that they were in the middle of installing a new heating system and they could have adjusted the heat for us from outside the room. This may have been a bit of necessary information at check-in, not check-out.. Also, from the past reviews, it seems as though many others have complained about this heating problem as far back as 2005 so I guess it is quite a lengthly installation process huh? I am not a Hilton necessary type of person, but this place was the pits. Good thing I had good company to be there with or I really would have written a lousy review!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Hungry_Hippo_UK
Reviews.Content: When all other hotels and B&B's had failed me, the Buckminster came to my rescue and not only had availability but also came in cheaper than anyone else - although still not what I'd call cheap but then you'll find Boston is very pricey. As I was in Boston just to look around all I really wanted was somewhere just to put my head down for the night, I wasn't looking for luxury because I didn't plan on spending anything but essential sleeping time there. And it did just that - nothing fancy but not worthy of the bad reports I've seen on Trip Advisor.The hotel is brilliantly located - Fenway Park is a few hundred yards away, there's restaurants all over the place and access to the subway is just down the road (Top tip: taxi from the airport cost me a rip off $35 but I got a 7 day pass on the T for $15 which gave me unlimited travel around Boston and I used that to get back to the airport from Buckminster - and that was surprisingly no hassle). If you choose to walk around the city like I did most of the time you'll find the harbour is about an hour away, which sounds a lot but it's well worth it if you want to get a real feel for the city. The only problem I'd have with the Buckminster is the breakfast in the restaurant next door, which was quite basic and managed by two Japanese ladies who couldn't understand a word of what I was saying. Apart from that, everything was fine - oh, and I should point out that I thought the staff were really helpful and quite conversational. I would definitely recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: AmaliaO
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an accessable place to stay while close to Fenway... This place can't be beat! Price moderate $109 a night is good for the location. Room is clean and bath is decent. Not much to look at but great for tired people who don't freak out about everything. We had no trouble getting from the Logan airport to the hotel via the Metro. Get a $2 "Charlie" card to travel one way... nice! Then we took the Freedom Trail which is alot of walking but worth it. Once you are tired and a bit cold stop into the Au Bon Pain, where you can get a hot meal for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Charger06
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute trip and we had difficulty finding availability in the Back Bay area of Boston. The Buckminster is one maybe two blocks from the Back Bay so everything worked out fine. Our room was spotless and extremely comfortable and the service was fantastic, very friendly and professional staff from check in to check out. During our stay we learned that Fenway Park was a stones throw from the Buckminster. We ended up getting tickets and seeing a game which was the highlight of my trip because I've always wanted to get inside the oldest Ball Park in America. My wife and I travel often and I would highly recommend the Buckminster Hotel to anyone who is looking for a great value. One thing is for sure, Iâ€™ll be staying at the Buckminster again. No need to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For A Sox Game”
Reviews.Author: ResortRunner25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 5 min walk from Fenway Park. There are a ton of great restaurants around the hotel. The front desk staff was great and vary professional. I only had two problems with my stay here. The parking is in a building next to the hotel and is not run by the hotel; it is run by a company called LAZ. We were not told about this at the time of booking. When we showed up to park the LAZ guys asked us for our keys to park our car for us because its a red sox game day and we cant self park here and that they had to do it. Kind of threw us off a bit, we didnâ€™t really trust giving some strange guy our car keys. All went well with them though they are vary professional and kind. The hotel is located in a vary busy part of town. Get there early if there is a sox game or else you will be circling around the hotel waiting for the game crowd to leave. The room we stayed in is great if your looking for just a bed to sleep in. It was nothing special. The rate was a little high for what we got but id pay it again just for its location to Fenway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdavidsonec
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine was visiting from Florida and he wanted to catch a Sox game while in town. Getting tickets was easier than finding a hotel room in the city. Eventually, after much searching, I called the Buckminster and found a room with two beds for $179, which was about a hundred bucks cheaper than anything else I could find. The hotel was right around the corner from Fenway Park and our room had a view of the park. The Sox lost that night, but we had a great time at the game and after the game at some of the many bars around the hotel. We both thought the hotel was fine. Nothing out of this world, but affordable, clean and the hotel employees were nice enough. I wish I had known about this place years ago, cause I've been spending $400 a night whenever I stay in Boston. If you are going to see the Sox or looking for a less expensive hotel in the city, I would suggest trying this place out if you just need a decent room without all the thrills. The room came with a free continental breakfast the next morning, which was a added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Buckminster Hotel has great character”
Reviews.Author: poppiekat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of character and charm, but is not for the person who is a hotel snob. The rates are reasonable and there are no frills and no pampering....just a good, clean place to sleep before going out for whatever you came to Boston to do. THE STAFF IS EXCEPTIONAL and will go the extra mile to make your stay pleasant and comfortable. It was refreshing to get away from the "cookie cutter" type of motel room for a change. This is an old hotel that has been cleaned up and modernized but still retains a feeling of that yesteryear feeling. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean and bright and was located on the inside area which made it exceptionally quiet (no street noise at all). There was no stale smell present in the room. The bath had been updated with a new quarry tile floor and a new pedistal style sink. The only mirror was in the bath room; however, it would have been nice to have a second mirror in the bedroom, as well. The refrigerator, microwave and TV all worked fine. Replacement windows with screens were new, also. It was great to have the new bi-fold blinds instead of those heavy lined drapes. THE ONLY COMPLAINT WE HAD WAS THE GOD-AWFUL COLORS USED IN PAINTING THE HALLWAYS AND ROOMS....the bedspreads were a little ugly, too. The owners need to get advice from an American decorator......and fast!!! Perhaps in future remodeling, this will be corrected. We decided that since the room was clean, the prices were so reasonable and since we were in the room such a short time, we could overlook the colors on the walls. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and I fully intend to stay here when I visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “hated the buckminster”
Reviews.Author: ron4468
Reviews.Content: room was dirty. the remote didn't work, the fridge was so iced over the door wouldn't close. when i called for assistance it took over 24 hours. the ad said it was close to everything the only thing it is near is fenway park. parking was very expensive , was told they had parking not told parking was paid. if you moved your car after paying for the entire stay, you might not have a space when you got back. so, you are forced to either use mass transit or a cab to go anywhere..

Reviews.Title: “Buckminster and Fenway”
Reviews.Author: Treestump
Reviews.Content: We were on a baseball weekend, and you couldn't get closer to Fenway park unless someone dropped you off in front. It was very close to the subway, and just a few stops from historical places. There were also great sports bars within walking distance. The facility was roomy, clean, and full of character. We arrived about midnight, and the staff was both cheerful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches”
Reviews.Author: JudithV
Reviews.Content: I know this sounds like a complete contradiction.....the hotel was very clean....but we had a roach in our bathroom. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fleabag Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgilligan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly opposite Boston University. It claims to be "restored to its prior grandeur". I was looking for a nice, inexpensive hotel for my family to attend a seminar at Boston U. I assumed since it was across the street that it would be nice. $150.00 for the night. The parking for the hotel was below street level and there were burned out cars, trash and very unsecured parking. That should have been my first indication of what we would find. The lobby was ok. Old, but ok. The upstairs was horrible. The rooms looked like old dorm rooms from the 1970s. They had a small kitechenette in each room. The furnishings were old, the linens were old, the walls were cracked and dirty. The place was just awful. We stayed and slept and got right out. Please do not stay- I cant imagine anyone being comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine”
Reviews.Author: NC_tar_heel_64
Reviews.Content: I too was apprehensive about staying there after reading reviews. But it was much less expensive than the conference hotels and a 10 minute walk to the convention center. My room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. The only downside was some hallway noise from late-night baseball fans post-game. We skipped the offered breakfast - it did not seem attractive. But the front desk people were quite nice, the remodeling was effective, and we experienced none of the horror of some reviewers. I am guessing they rarely stay in anything but a generic chain hotel, and certainly never outside the US.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: nmcjtc
Reviews.Content: Thie staff is horribly rude parking is first come first serve the bed are uncomfortable. They allow scalpers to conduct business in the lobby. All in all it was the worst hotel I have ever been to I would prefer motel 6. I strongly urge you not to ruin your vacation stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Beds, Awful Service, Much Better Values Available!”
Reviews.Author: NHJay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had tickets to see the Sox play the Yankees with another couple we are friends with. Our friends booked a room with the hotel thinking it would be a great place to stay, especially with the proximity to Fenway. To start with, my wife called the night we were to arrive with a question regarding parking, right off the bat the guy she was on the phone with told her that if she had a problem with their parking policies that he would just cancel her reservation. My wife hadn't even started to complain yet or give her name, she just mentioned she had a question. Once we arrived, we discovered that the hotel doesn't have it's own parking, they rent spaces from a tiny garage which is next to the hotel. Parking is first come, first serve and if the Sox are playing you more than likely won't get a space. Thankfully we managed to squeeze in but this is a fact we should have been made aware of ahead of time. We had two nights booked, the first was so/so, the beds are very hard and uncomfortable and the pillows might as well not be there, they provide no support at all. As for the second night, we were on our way back from Fenway after seeing the Sox smash the Yanks and as we were about to walk into the building, some fool from the 3rd floor decided he was going to throw things out the window. He had already thrown a pillow out, then proceeded to dump a cup of water on my wife. We approached the front desk staff with the issue and they said that there was nothing they could/would do and that if we wanted it taken care of, we'd have to call the police. I don't think he expected us to call, but we did. So Boston PD showed up. The front desk clerk tried to play off what happened but BPD convinced them they needed to take care of their customers. We were able to determine what room they issue came from and with persuasion from BPD finally got an apology from the staff. It shouldn't have taken us calling the police for them to address unruly guests. If it were my hotel I would want to make sure it was addressed so that this type of thing doesn't bring down the reputation of my facility. Needless to say, between this and issues we had with parking, i.e. the parking attendant locking our car key in his booth and then going home for the night, we decided not to stay for the second night and instead went home. I will never stay here again and advise anyone else considering it to find other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StandingRoom
Reviews.Content: First, I must admit that I was somewhat apprehensive about staying at the Buckminster after reading a few reviews online. But what can you expect for the affordability and given the age of the hotel? The renovations to the lobby are complete, and look great. The staffs at the front desk are very approachable. We stayed in a suite consisting of 2 bedrooms and a bathroom. One room had a queen size bed and the other room had two double beds. The rooms are in need of renovation. The walls are dirty, smudged and it's apparent that the plaster has seen many years of repairs. But the beds are clean! Each room has a small color TV with cable. After exiting the small elevator, you may encounter an unfriendly smell (cigarette smoke and cooking food) but the rooms are fine.There are common kitchen areas on each floor so donâ€™t be surprised to find your neighbor cooking. The parking garage is located next to the hotel (on the same side of the street) as the hotel. There are several parking spots in front of the hotel without meters and believe it or not, we were able to get one and not pay a cent for three days! Even during days when there were baseball games. The MBTA station (Kenmore) is located across the intersection, a few steps away from a Dunkin Donuts and McDonalds. Of course, the hotels proximity to Fenway Park is the biggest reason for Red Sox fan to stay here, though the Hojo's on Boylston is closer and comparable in quality. There is a freeyou may hear the fire alarm going off around 6am. The front desk said this is common. Perhaps a way to get checkouts up and out? This may not be a place for a honeymooning couple but definitely recommended for Sox fans that are not overly picky and history buffs!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: cyn0002
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! The toilet seats in both rooms we booked were filthy w/urine and feces. The carpets have a thick layer of dust on top especially lining the walls. The air conditioning does not work properly. In fact there are signs posted under the thermostats in the room stating to leave the temp within a certain range which is ridiculous; if you pay for a room you should be able to keep it as cold or warm as you sit fit for comfort!!!! There was no hot water to shower in the morning. The staff just kept saying "Well we are at full capacity." They did nothing to fix the problem. Moldy fluff fell out of a ceiling tile. The whole place from the moment you step in reaks of mold and stale cigarrettes. My friend's room came with a half drank bottle of water and a lollipop half eaten stuck to his armoir and towels with something that looked like motor oil stained on them. The rooms do come w/ fridges and microwaves and are cheap for Boston and in a great location. If you do not care about cleanliness this would be great but if you like a clean, comfortable room this is not the place. We booked two rooms(we traveled with a friend) for the first night. The second night we booked a suite but it was so awful as well that we upgraded to the Hotel Commonwealth instead and had a considerably better time there and staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Better Deals than the Buckminster”
Reviews.Author: survivorfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buckminster in 2004 (I know it's been a while, but I was just thinking about the trip today) and we were not all that impressed. The hotel is promoted as being Victorian and full of antiques... and the pictures online are decently nice. However, we just found it was just plain old. I suppose Victorian is just a nice way of saying old. Yes, true, Boston is an old city ...with a tremendous amount of charm. I actually loved Boston. However, for the price you pay at Buckminster, old hard beds with musty smelling sheets and a stand alone sink with NO counter space at all in the bathroom leaves something to be desired. I do have to say that the breakfast at the teeny little restaurant (and I do mean teeny) downstairs was actually quite tasty. To their credit, they were renovating the lobby at the time, but still that seem to have no bearing on the old hard beds and must sheets. However, our next trip to Boston was exactly one year later in 2005, and we stayed at the Radisson which is just across the river...and loved it. It is a far better deal with comfy beds, clean, non-musty accommodations and a japanese steakhouse, lounge/bar to boot. It is just across the river from the Buckminster, about a 5 minute cab ride, in the Boston University area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LolaAnsel
Reviews.Content: We planned a college reunion to coincide with the Head of the Charles regetta, in which we were also competing. After pricing several hotels in Boston and factoring the cost of cabs, we choose the Buckminster for its location. It's central (i.e. walking distance) to our guest boathouse, shops, downtown, food and Fenway (although it was after post-season). It met all of our needs (4 women and 2 spouses, all in our mid to late 30s). Would I be happy if this was my honeymoon hotel? No. For a college reunion weekend and/or visiting local colleges, hitting up a Sox game, or otherwise paying for it on my own dime, it was great. It reminded me of an off-campus apartment in Boston, which was the perfect atomsphere for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,run-down hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeknows
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Buckminster five times when I was in grad school in Boston. The first couple of times were okay, but the last three stays were awful. "The Bucky's" location in Kenmore Square is super convenient to Fenway (across the street) and to the subway stop. It's relatively cheap and the rooms are okay. The hotel staff is courteous but refused to upgrade me... no perks for frequent stays. I asked for a quiet room and they gave me the noisiest room in the hotel (facing Fenway Park) with night game lights, noisy Boston Red Sox fans, seriously loud street noise and the commuter rail. If you stay there ask for a room that does not face Fenway! The air conditioning was on the fritz during two summer stays. Rooms are hot and stuffy, and with all the noise you can't really open the windows. Winter stays were more pleasant. This hotel is good for students and Red Sox Fans, not good for families, the eldery.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible , stinky, Fleas and all ....”
Reviews.Author: ebaytraveller
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for EBay live and ended up in this stinky place. I can only say smells like urine & cigarette mix . The first night Boston was really cold staff would not turn heat on ... the hallway was warmer than the room. I was itchy all night -I guess fleas .Really dirty carpet and dirty rooms . My second day , I came to the hotel at night went straight to my room found "Do not disturb" sign on the door and my key would not work ...... oh yeah , they moved me to another room and I was not told I would move to another room so to pack my stuff so they could move it . They moved my stuff for me to another room leaving , my computer cables , some documents that I had left on the table, phone charger and a few other items .I tried to retrive items but employees at the desk could care less, very rude and extremely poor customer service. I have sooo much more to say BUT to summarise please do not stay at this hotel if you want to enjoy boston. This is the worst hotel I ever stayed in and i have my fingers crossed that i am disease free so far ........

Reviews.Title: “1st experience with the Buck was good overall”
Reviews.Author: MassMick
Reviews.Content: While we were hesitant to book here due to some sketchy reviews, we decided give it a try , especially since it was only for one night. Things we loved were that the hotel was literally across the Turnpike from Fenway Park and right on Commonwealth Ave, the low rate (159.00) for a king suite within city limits and the proximity to the subway. All those things are as advertised and the hotel is a great spot to have as a home base. We stayed on the 5th floor of the 6 floor hotel. The elevator although a little small was clean and not slow. The king bed was newer, firm and very comfortable to sleep in. The living room was nice to have as we like to spread out and that's nearly impossible if you just have a single room with a bed. The hotel (what we observed) itself was NOT dirty and dingy or smelly. The room was clean with only some dust on the high dresser in the bedroom. Behind the bed was clean(always a sign of lazy cleaning when dirty) and vacuumed. The double windows and shutters did dampen some of the inner city noise but not all( hey, it's a BIG city). We expected some traffic noise considering it's location and were not bothered by what did come through. The room (all of them ) had a working refridgerator and microwave and there was a clean, large cooking area with sinks and a stove on each floor. When we had to deal with the staff they were all courteous and helpful. The weather temperature was perfect so we needed no heat or air conditioning so I can't rate how they worked. Self parking was readily available for 18.00 a day right next door and the attendant there was courteous. There were some slight spotting on the room carpet but nothing drastic at all. My biggest and probably only complaint was the bathroom towels. They were not up to snuff as they were thin, old, and although cleaned and hopefully bleached, were spotted, as were the replacements that were given to us without a problem. I would suggest bringing a couple of your own towels or do as we did, dry off with some clean, extra tee shirts. The continental breakfast is nothing but some tupperwares filles with bread, bagels,muffins, etc served inside the attached Japanese restuarant and we passed on it. McDonalds and Dunkin Donuts are both right next door and will fill the gap for you. We live just 90 miles away in W. Massachusetts, so we know the area well and I can tell you from experiance that this is a good location to have as homebase for a few days, especially if you don't like driving alot. As stated earlier , the subway (Green Line/Kenmore Station) is just a couple blocks from The Buckminster and can take right to most attractions in the city including North Station where you can get a commuter train and will take you to just about any cities that are around Boston from Plymouth to Glouchester/Newberryport to Providence, RI.. The place isn't the Ritz but for the price I know that I'll be giving them another try at some point. But I'll bring some towels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for after the Sox Game!!”
Reviews.Author: 10E_Girl
Reviews.Content: We went to a Red Sox game for my bachelorrette party and stayed at the Buckminster. There were 12 of us girls and not 1 single complaint. It was within a 3 min walk to Fenway. The building is old, but in very good shape and they were doing some renovating while we were there. The rooms were clean and staff was very nice. It was perfect for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay after a ballgame”
Reviews.Author: mainahh
Reviews.Content: The Buckminster has had it's entire lobby remodeled and is much improved. Rooms were clean and acceptable. Bathroom was small, but I haven't found a hotel room with an acceptable size bathroom yet (especially shower). Room was PLENTY big enough. We had a great experience at the Buckminster. Staff was very friendly to us. If you're looking for a Ritz Carlton room, it's not here, but it's not as bad as other reviews make it out to be. Some people just are never happy. We stayed at the Buckminster over Patriot's Day weekend and was an ideal spot for staying after a Sox game, or taking in the Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Buckminster!”
Reviews.Author: anna10582
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Buck on the day of the Boston Marathon and the Red Sox game, and while the location couldn't have been better (above Uno's, facing Fenway, and at the one-mile marker of the Marathon) the staff was pleasant and very accomodating. They allowed us to check our bags in earlier than our check-in time for the room, and even allowed us to leave our bags there after we checked out the next day. The room was a little smelly, but i was VERY pleasantly surprised at the overall experience. It was the last hotel i could find a room at for this date, and it was affordable as well. I was a little skeptical, after reading some of the reviews, but i couldn't reccomend the Buckminster more highly I have definatly stayed in MUCH worse rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the Buckminster”
Reviews.Author: Purina_Kat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overall really sketchy and I definitely won't be staying there again. I actually wanted to ask for my money back...but who wants to fight the staff? First, the towels they gave us had STAINS on them, as if they were used and not washed. GROSS! Second, the cleaning staff left a chewed up piece of gum in the bathroom. How sanitary is that? I know the price is pretty cheap...but seriously...only use this hotel if you have no other choice!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck in Fenway Park area”
Reviews.Author: SoxFaninNJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at "The Buck" many, many times while up in Boston to watch the Sox. This Hotel is old, tired, but clean. Dealing with the staff can be frustrating but they try their best. Fenway is basically accross the street. If you want upscale 4 star, then I suggest the Hotel Commonwealth, also in Kenmore Square. Bottom line for the Buckminster 2 nights at the Buck = $300.00 Stay 2 nights at the Hotel Commonwealth = $750.00 Buck looks a bit better now, don't it ? Go Sox

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful and cockroaches! Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: dancer1984
Reviews.Content: This is with out a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed it. I booked it after a recomendation from a friend's sibling who said it was great and you couldn't beat the price. I was disgusted with it as soon as we got to our room, it was small and dingy looking. I tried to attribute it to the fact that it is an old building and that I'm used to very clean things. I wanted to leave and find a new hotel but every place we called was booked solid. I should have gone with my instinct because after hesitantly climbing into the dirty bed that night we we're woke up to the sounds of a COCKROACH early in the morning, that had crawled into a plastic bag of cleaning supplies we had bought which was on the floor. I immediately ran out of the room and down to the front desk where the clerk proceeded to yell at me and told me they had no such problem. He refused to let me speak to a manager or give me any money off of my stay. He sent someone up to the room to find the roach, which we watched run under the bed before I left the room, but because he didn't see it they told me I was lying. Needless to say, as my boyfriend was packing our bags, he found a 'roach motel' hidden in between the television stand and a dresser. The staff here was so rude and unhelpful I advise anyone thinking of staying here not to. The prices are cheap but it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed OK”
Reviews.Author: RJB21
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was OK -- like flibis below, I found it a bit shabby (and our room was very small) but not dirty. It's certainly not luxurious but it seemed a good budget destination and is cheap for (relatively) central Boston. However, when we came to check out, they charged us more than we were quoted on the phone. As we had no written confirmation (eg an email) there wasn't much we could do about this, so if you do go for the Buckminster, I would suggest asking for an email or postal confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller15
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very dirty. I had to ask to change rooms because my bed and pillows were smelly. The floors have not been cleaned for years, seriously. The bathroom had hairs all over it, sink, bathtub, floors.. this is the most disgusting place I have ever been. Do not waste your money on this place, they are careless.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All!”
Reviews.Author: flibis
Reviews.Content: I was so paranoid to stay at the Buckminster Hotel after reading the reviews on this site, but I needed a room for three nights and it was very cheap for Boston so I had no choice. The hotel was fine, our room was clean, the staff was nice, and the location was amazing. The people working at the front desk were not rude at all as I had expected after reading these reviews, but rather very helpful and friendly. In fact they were easy to joke around with and gave me great directions to local attractions. My only kind of complaint would be that the bed was uncomfortable, but I am used to sleeping on a really comfy bed, so I'm just picky. We stayed in 520 and the room was clean, I did not see any bugs, or mice like some of the reviews say. The bathroom seemed newly renovated. I'm not going to lie, the Buckminster isn't the Ritz Carlton, but it's not bad at all. If you are expecting a four star, marbled bathroom style hotel, go somewhere else. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel room, then the Buckminster Hotel is fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good idea”
Reviews.Author: tobiasj
Reviews.Content: There was a mouse in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Dump!”
Reviews.Author: baseballfan2519
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much but this plac eis a dump. The lobby is the nicest part of the hotel. The room we stayed in (525) had not been cleaned since Babe Ruth stayed here. We had a two bed room suite. One room had puke on the wall. This place could be a bargain if they would just clean the room. Being old is no excuse not to clean. The walls were nasty, the capert smelled. I bought Lysol and sprayed the bed, sheets, floor and entire bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even bother”
Reviews.Author: Alderley
Reviews.Content: Don't even slow your car down to look! The lobby of this hotel is the only nice thing about it. The rooms are clean but shabby and very dated. We were told we had a double room, we did, with two single beds. The room was minute. And after speaking with 2 Boston Cops about what goes on in the hotel...I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!! Rodents!! Prostitutes! Health Risks! Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: Lawyersneedsleep2
Reviews.Content: Be affraid ...very affraid! This is quite possibly the worst hotel in America! From the extremely unprofessional, rude front desk management to the applauling room conditions and price...this hotel should be shut down!! My family stayed there while dropping our daughter off to BU. During our stay we encountered the following: Filth Everywhere on most every surface. There was even blood on our youngest daughter's sheets. We left when we realized that it was our daughters blood from being bitten from bed bugs found scattered on the bed and pillow cases. An extreme rodent /pest control problem. Rats in our room. Bugs in the kitchen, covering the cooking surfaces. Sewage water dripping down the wall from a saturated cieling onto the kitchen counter top. An overflowing 3 foot high trash can! (At the time of our premature departure 3 days.later .the trash had yet to be emptied) A loud heating sytem that blew room temp. dust particals that smelled of cheap perfume. This scent is also pumped throughout the entire floor. We went to make the well dressed asian man who claimed to be the manager aware of these troubles, only to find apathy. Not only did he not care in the slightest he invited us to "do whatever it is you have to do...and go!! My kids almost flipped out when they heard the young man raising his voice to their grandmother. We were charged $220+ for each night of horror. I cannot believe that a hotel can operate like this in contemporary America. Meanwhile we are bracing ourselves for what will most likely prove to be an ugly legal battle as we will be taking this sham of a hotel to court ..just after we collect more information from others who may have had similiar encounters at this seedy place. Word to the wise..you're better off paying a little bit more up front then absorbing the healthcare expenses and emotional damage from staying at this flop house.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Crappy and Charged My Debit Card Twice”
Reviews.Author: robingee
Reviews.Content: Bleh... This place was kind of spooky in a Shining sort of way, with narrow twisty corridors that smell musty and funky. The room was clean enough to be tolerable, but the big kicker is that they charged my debit card twice and it took many phone calls to rectify it, which they finally did. The location is good though. It's a fine fleabag place for baseball fans to camp out in.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty below standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Farnesol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and could be much better than it is. Unfortunately, the cleaning standard was so low it was really incredable. There was filth on the bathroom walls (easily cleanable if anyone bothered just to run a wet cloth over the walls). Between the bed and night stand there were hugh dust balls, old hair, previous occupants medicine tablets and other junk and crud. The widow frames were so covered in dust and filth that after I opened the window my hands had dirt all over them. It is really bad - and I have traveled all over the world and never stayed in a hotel like this. Even the halls were filthy. The whole place needs some paint too. It seems that this is also a hotel where some guests live - it feels like a flop house. The big problem with this place is managment. Even the breakfast that was included was so "low rent" as to be insulting with mini supermarket donuts avaialble as self-serve on styrofoam. The place needs serious attention. A real pitty.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy,Filthy, Filthy..”
Reviews.Author: XYZ321
Reviews.Content: -Bathroom condition is indescribable mold/soap scum every inch of shower not even exagerating. -Managers could care less. -I called boston ma dept of health and we all filed complaints. -I give the hotel benefit of the doubt that the sheets were clean, not sure though. -Curtain missing also and we opened windows and the screens were up already-thank god I didn't bring my small children they could have fell out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jess98ac
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and then read some not so great reviews and almost cancelled, I'm glad we didn't. My husband and I stayed for one night to spend a day in Boston and go to the Red Sox game that night. We arrived about 11 (it was a Friday) and were able to check in right away. They gave us a voucher to park for $18 overnight at a garage right next door, we just had to be out by noon the next day. This was a great deal since it costs $30 just park for a game. We had a king bed room on the 4th floor overlooking Fenway Park. The room was a decent size. There was the bed, 2 nightstands, a desk and an armoire with the TV and a few drawers. There were 2 small closets with full length mirrors on the armoire, as well. There was also another VERY small closet in the room. The bathroom was SMALL, but clean and fine for a short stay. There was a continental breakfast offered but we didn't make it down on time. This is an old building and it shows, but we didn't see any dirt or bugs or anything. You can't beat the location or the price for Boston. Would we stay here a week? Probably not. Would we go back for a night or 2, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Brunello5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Fenway Park. I went up there for a Red Sox game and had trouble finding a hotel that was not in the two hundred price range,. I finally decided on the Burkminister even though terrible reviews are posted on tripadvisor. It was totally wonderful, very spacious, and very clean and the people there are great. Ask for Mike. I was there with my two sons. I had a room with a king size bed and they had a room with two doubles.... and it was all the same apartment. It was a wonderful experience... actually we did not want to leave because it was so pleasant. I would recommend it to anyone. It is also in a great location with lots going on and is over 100 years old and truly a beautiful building.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel was perfectly acceptable. It reminded me of various affordable European hotels I have stayed in. No, it's not brand new. But it has a lot of character. They don't make them like this anymore. Two foot thick exterior walls, high ceilings, and big, double paned windows. It was clean, and uninfested, unlike what others have written. Really, I have no idea what they saw or even if they were in the same hotel. The staff were all very helpful and courteous. It was close to everything we needed including restaurants, shopping, the subway, various universities, even Fenway Park. I have no complaints. We had wireless internet available in our room, the a/c was plenty cold, the water was plenty hot, there was a microwave and a fridge, and we even were able to upgrade to a larger set of rooms for a minimal charge, so there were two TVs. I would stay there again. Affordable with old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at one of the busiest traffic intersections in all of Boston. The car horns, sirens and other street noises keep you awake all night long mainly because the rooms have no curtains. There are only broken wood shutters that do nothing to keep street noises out. The heat is inefficient and our rooms were freezing. The young woman at the front desk was rude, obnoxious and discourteous. The rate for this particular weekend was (with taxes) $225 per night. I have stayed in other chain hotels at a quarter of the price that were cleaner, had larger rooms and I certainly didnt have to put up with rude employees. In the interest of being fair, I will say that the newly renovated lobby is gorgeous, but the rooms are filthy and the furniture is ancient and broken. The bedrooms are so small that you have to wiggle next to the bed to get into them. The TV screen had so much scum on it, that I initally thought the reception was blurred. If you decide to stay at this hotel, make sure you bring plenty of windex and ajax, so you can scrub the bathroom before you use it. Also, dont forget the room spray to help with the awful odor. I have traveled extensively through the US and Europe and I can honestly tell you that I have never seen a hotel as dirty as this one was and have never seen a room in such disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “Obscene.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: $180 for a junior suite with paint chips on the wall, scratched furniture, stained carpet, no hot water in the shower, exposed electrical wiring. Just awful. As it's across from Fenway Park, it must be a party hotel for baseball fans.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in the room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here! It's filthy--there were actually mice in the room! To top it off, when we left because of the mice, we were charged for the room--AND the manager was rude and never apologized. I can't believe the Buckminster actually has the nerve to charge $229 per night for mice, filth, and rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Buckminster and the hotel was very dirty. The headboard of the first room was broken and the lights didn't work. I got switched to another room that had ants in the bed. The third room had hairs in the bed. My room got switched 7 times because I kept complaining about the conditions of the room. My sheets were not changes, and I am not sure if the sheets I slept in were even clean. Plus, the area is very noisy. I was happy to leave, and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in the streets of Baghdad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever, unless you are looking for a crack house. Construction has been ongoing for years and I don't think the bedsheets had been cleaned since the construction began. Jumping in the Boston Harbor would have provided cleaner and warmer water than the showers here. Tip for travellers: though the nightly rate is cheap, I would not stay here again even if I was offered a free night's stay. STAY AWAY FROM THE BUCKMINSTER! A fitting quote from another trip advisor review was: "I thought a homeless person was going to jump out of the closet and kill my family while we were sleeping".

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Stay Here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on New Years Eve. Upon check in we were greeted by extremely unfriendly front desk staff. Once in our room we immediately had to open the window, which we had to prop open with the ice bucket, in order to eleviate the extremely foul odor that was in the room. This was the most disgusting place that either of us has ever been to. You do receive a coupon for a free breakfast however both of us just wanted to get home and shower.

Reviews.Title: “The foulest place imaginable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place was absolutely filthy, inside and out, and the perpetual "construction" (with walls and floors covered with plastic and tape, but no workmen ever in sight), according to the locals, has been going on for years already. We had planned to stay for 3 nights, but escaped after the first. The room was stinking and dirty, the bed covers looked like a mummy had died in them. Service was absolutely sub-stardard by any standards. Do yourself a favor and avoid a nightmare experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Buckminster is a BONK!”
Reviews.Author: pmac2382
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunate to have stayed in the Hotel Buckminster for three consecutive nights. If it was not such a busy long weekend in the Boston area, we would have cancelled our reservation immediately. This hotel is well below average, especially in a city such as Boston where there are so many great hotels to choose from. The hotel is in the middle of rennovations, which are apparent as soon as you walk in the front door. There is plywood in the lobby, and duck tape holding down the carpet/rug. There are two halls as narrow as one person on each side of the front desk leading to small four person elevators. One of the elevators was not working for the majority of our stay. We had a 1BR suite, with 3 beds. The layout of the room was excellent with enough space to not feel crowded. The condition of the room was horrific. The carpet in the room looked as though it had been a murder scene. Large dark spots where something had obviously sat in disgust for a very long period of time. In the main bedroom, there are two large windows. Only one of the windows actually had a curtain, which made for a very unappealing visual. The view was of the highway, with Fenway Park in the backdrop. If it weren't for the great view of Fenway, this review would have been worse. Behind the tv armoire was a dirty tube sock, apparently from a recent visitor. The comforter had some mysterious stains with texture. There was one thermostat for the room, but apparently it did not actually adjust the air/heat. We set our thermostat on 68 degrees, and after several hours we returned to our room to see that the temperature was well over 85 degrees, with the heat "just a blowin." After two calls to the front desk, the heat was finally turned off from the front desk. Hotel Buckminster obviously has full-time residents, and there were several very sketchy residents on the 6th floor. One decided that the television should remain on, at full volume for four consecutive days. This became a large nuissance at night when we were trying to sleep over the highway truck noise and construction. Another very interesting resident decided to walk down the hall in nothing but his boxer shorts to do his laundry. This made for very uncomfortable women in our group. The amenities include continental breakfast of instant coffee that you make yourself downstairs, or access to the connecting japanese/sushi bar, which runs karaoke until 2am. Very interesting to hear karaoke singing for women to take their tops off in this establishment. Not only should you not stay at the Hotel Buckminster, but you should write to your Congressman to have it condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Buckminster sucks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Listen to other reviews with caution. I stayed there for 3 nights, and it was the worst 3 nights of my life. First night the fire alarm went off at 3am, false alarm. Second night same alarm, again false alarm. And when I left the hotel they charged both my credit cards with the full amount of the stay. And it is true it is under construction. So it smells, and looks like a construction site. "Complementary" breakfast was the worst I have ever had, burned coffee, and greasy eggs, with burned bacon. Honestly if you like to pay alot and sleep at a construction site the Buckminster is for you. Yes location is great, but any location on a subway line is great in Boston. Public transport is clean, safe, and cheap as hell, take advantage of it! I suggest to any traveler, stay anywhere but the Buckminster.

Reviews.Title: “The worst! Housekeeping are thiefs!”
Reviews.Author: kikinpr
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of clothing items dissapear from my room and the front desk couldn't have cared less. Extremely rude staff! Place is a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm generally a laid back person - I've slummed it in hostels across Europe, I don't generally get that worked up about little things - but this was absolutely the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in. In fact I bundled up in all of my clothes so I wouldn't have to touch the blankets on the bed b/c it's hard to say when the last time they washed anything there. Filthy is the best word to describe the Buckminster. Granted they are doing construction right now so maybe it's not always quite so bad but it's no excuse for letting the entire place stew in filth. Only good thing about the place is the location but even if I was falling down drunk after a Red Sox world series I don't think I would be able to sleep there again

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have cancelled my stay right when I walked in. The entire lobby is under construction, yet we saw no construction people working. We stayed two nights. Upon inspection of the room we found hair on the "clean" towels. A sign by the thermostat in the room says not to put the heat below 68 or the main unit shuts down. The room was so hot we slept with the window open all night. I finally turned the thermostat down anyway. The TV was in an amoire on the LEFT side of the bed (with the shelves still wrapped in bubble wrap on the bottom). Ever try to watch TV in bed when the TV is on the left wall? The TV remote didn't work. There were no extra pillows. The bathroom was dirty and the light above the sink had four different kind of lightbulbs, two of which were burned out. The tub filled up with water when you showered. Our stay included breakfast in the morning next door at a Japanese restaurant. It was horrible. When we entered, all the tables were dirty and there was only one waitress. We sat at a dirty table for at least 15 minutes before we got service. The food was so horrible that the next day's breakfast we skipped even though it was included in our stay. After a day in Boston we returned to our room to find that our bed was made (well, they put the sheets back in place but didn't tuck in the sides), the carpet was not vacuumed, they never gave us any more soap, shampoo or plastic cups, there was a bit lint ball on the bathroom floor, and only one set of towels instead of two (We called the front desk who said they'd send some up. They never came.) We had to call again the next morning. This place was an absolute dump. I've never stayed in a more disgusting hotel. We tried to find other accommodations nearby, because we already paid for two nights parking, for our second night but every place was full.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ldraz
Reviews.Content: The Buckminster Hotel exceeded my expectations in terms of value for the money spent. Other hotels in Boston are at least twice as much and in many cases three times as much. The lobby is being renovated but the rooms were quiet and comfortable. The staff was courteous and friendly and breakfast was included. I would highly recommend this hotel for travelers who do not want to drop a bundle on their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THRILLED by the Buckminster. Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: likeachamp
Reviews.Content: I tentatively booked a 4 night stay at this hotel. I loved the location, as we were going to Red Sox games. I loved the UNHEARD of style of 2 bedrooms and a living room for $200 in Boston. I liked the idea of the free breakfasts, the fridges in the rooms, the kitchens on the floors. I liked it all. THEN, i read some of the reviews on the site. That scared me like crazy. But after going ahead with the booking, we gave it a shot. I walked in, and the staff was incredibly friendly. Very helpful. The way to the room was pretty messy....mostly due to rennovations, but it was hardly 'disgusting' or even an issue. The rooms are very large and clean. There is a lot of wear on the walls and everything....but it's over a hundred years old!!! It was not unappealing and all the furniture was fine. Very comfy beds too. It's not a 5-star hotel, and it doesn't pretend to be. But it IS clean, it offers so many things that you won't find in Boston (especially for that price), the location is awesome, and if you're travelling with more than 2 people, it's absolutely perfect. Especially if you're going to Sox games. I highly recommend it, and would be more than happy to stay there on my next visit. It would be a shame if you were to not stay there because of some negative reviews you see on here. Clearly they were more concerned with feeling like they were at the Ritz Carlton than they were about having a clean, convenient, and very nice room. But you'll be missing out if you choose not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Dirty, But Can't Beat Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of Sept/beginning of Oct at the Buckminster Hotel in Boston. First the good: the price was right-- $99-138 per night and it includes a free breakfast at the restaurant next door. You get to pick from 4 different selections on the menu. The location is EXCELLENT!! You are literally feet from Fenway park and the Kenmore T stop so you can go almost anywhere in the city cheaply. The staff was also extremely courteous.
