Now the bad: it's a little rundown/dirty. The lobby/hallways are very dirty/dusty. Granted, the hotel is undergoing a major renovation, but there are years worth of grime on the floors. However, I felt like the things that really needed to be clean like sheets, towels, shower, etc. were clean-- so a little dirt on the floor was not that big of a deal. There was certainly less dirt in the room than in the hallways. Hopefully once the renovation is complete they will maintain the hotel with less dirt, but I'd stay there again anyway. For that price you can't beat it!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't set foot in Buckminster again”
Reviews.Author: mlemarose
Reviews.Content: Great location to Fenway, other than that, there is nothing to look forward to here. We stayed one night. Arrived at 4:30 and dropped off our bags to head to Fenway. Upon our return at 12:30AM we got a good look at what we were in for.... Construction aside, Our room was filthy: the carpet, the furniture, the doors Our bathroom had hair and a half used container of shampoo on the floor Our fridge had some leftovers in it There was also a room key left from the previous visitors. When I notified the desk of this upon check out they responded "Oh really? Ok I will let housekeeping know." No apology, no offer of any sort of discount.Wwe were just happy to be getting out of there! I hope the construction makes some big improvements!

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Alex047
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in September at the Buckminster. After reading some critical reviews here on TripAdvisor I must say that my expectations have been exceeded. I booked a regular room. The room was very spacious, we got the semicircular bay windows. The bathroom was nice, clean, large and modern. The room had a small fridge, which proved very useful. The subway station is very close, which makes its location very convenient. The staff was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the daily free copies of the Financial Times in the lobby. Yes, the lobby is under renovation, and the not-renovated area looks old and worn, but the rooms do not. My main problem was with the breakfast: it is not buffet. A coupon entitles you to 1 of 3 basic choices, which are insuficient. As you must order this takes a lot of time, 45 mins at least, so you start your day late and hungry...(that's where the fridge comes in handy...)

Reviews.Title: “street would have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel with another couple. We booked a suite with two bedrooms, one room was supposed to have two double beds and the other a queen, but when we got there we noticed that a queen and a double were in one room and a double in the other. we also noticed some papers under the bed. When we called the front desk they said that they would be more than happy to switch them and the filthy sheets that were on all of the beds. After the beds were moved we checked them out and realized that the paper was still under the bed only to later find out that they were used sanitary napkins. When we called the desk to tell them how disgusted we were and they basically said it was our problem not theirs. We were then told that we could get a full refund in the morning when we checked out which was also untrue. They have given me a number to call to try to claim a refund, which i do not see happening. one number i will be calling is the board of health because nobody should pay money to sleep in that filth, the streets would have been cleaner and probably friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “A bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: keef27
Reviews.Content: I stayed while seeing the Rolling Stones at Fenway Park. The hotel is steps away from the park and convenient to all public transportation. Room was clean and staff was pleasant. Remember, this is not a four star hotel!! But it is the kind of place you would expect to find Keith Richards roaming the hallways just around midnight. If that is okay with you, you will be very happy. Mike from Taunton, MA

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was not bad. True, there are planks that you have to walk across, but they are renovating, what do you expect? The room we had was not exactly sparkling, but it was clean, and it didn't smell like grease or vomit. I had an incredible view of the city and a view of the Park from the bedroom. The staff was very very helpful and nice. If you want a four star hotel, go stay at the Marriott and pay 289 dollars a night. I used the room just for sleeping and had a wonderful stay, and the price was very reasonable especially for being so close to the Park and the excitement.

HotelInfo.Name: Boston Hotel Buckminster
HotelInfo.Address: 645 Beacon St, Boston, MA 02215
